Food.name: 식량
Food.desc: [Food] 은 당신의 부족원들에게 필요한 식량입니다. 겨울이 되기전 비축하세요. Avoid starvation at all costs(전원이 굶어죽는것을 피하세요).

Wood.name: 목재
Wood.desc: [Wood] 는 건물을 건설하거나 장작의 재료로 쓰입니다, 특히 겨울에는 소모량이 더 많습니다.

Money.name: 크로나
Money.desc: [Money] 는 군사를 소집하거나 건물을 유지하는데에 쓰입니다.

Happy.name: 행복도
Happy.desc: [Happy] will attract new villagers to your Town Hall. Improve your people's Happiness to accelerate this process.

Lore.name: 전승
Lore.desc: [Lore] discovered in Northgard will allow you to improve your clan's Knowledge.

Fame.name: 명예
Fame.desc: Increase your [Fame] and be proclaimed King of Northgard!

Stone.name: Stone
Stone.desc: [Stone] can be spent to upgrade your clan buildings.

Iron.name: Iron
Iron.desc: [Iron] is used to forge powerful weapons and craft better tools.

Prestige.name: Commercial Influence
Prestige.desc: [Prestige] can be earned by exploiting Great Trade Routes via a [Lighthouse].

RimeSteel.name: Rimesteel
RimeSteel.desc: [RimeSteel] is used to forge the mighty Wurmslayer.

Villager.name: 시민
Villager.desc: 시민은 야생에서 [Food] 를 수집합니다. 겨울동안 당신의 부족이 굶지않도록 비축하세요.

Woodcutter.name: Woodcutter
Woodcutter.desc: Specialized in harvesting [Wood], Woodcutters are necessary to improve your clan's settlement.

Farmer.name: Farmer
Farmer.desc: Experienced in growing crops, Farmers produce [Food] in larger quantities during summer.

Hunter.name: Hunter
Hunter.desc: Skilled Hunters will track and kill deer to provide [Meat] for your clan.

Fisherman.name: Fisherman
Fisherman.desc: Fishermen provide fresh [Fish] for your clan. Their production is not affected by winter.

Merchant.name: Merchant
Merchant.desc: Maintaining buildings and recruiting a Warband costs [Money]. Merchants generate steady income for your clan.

Sailor.name: Sailor
Sailor.desc: Sailors will raid nearby coasts and bring [Money] and [Fame] or [Lore] to your clan.
Sailor.props.noFameDesc: Sailors will raid nearby coasts and bring [Money] and [Lore] to your clan.

RuneMaster.name: Loremaster
RuneMaster.desc: Masters of ancient [Lore], they can study runestones, increasing your Knowledge.

InnKeeper.name: Brewer
InnKeeper.desc: A good Brewer provides a steady supply of ale and improves your clan's [Happy].

Skald.name: Skald
Skald.desc: Skalds' tales of your clan's deeds will increase your [Fame] and [Happy].
Skald.flavor: "Skald" literally means "poet." Skaldic poetry is one of the two main forms of Old Norse poetry, the other being Eddic poetry.

Miner.name: Miner
Miner.desc: Miners extract [Stone] and [Iron] from the area until the deposits are depleted.

Scout.name: Scout
Scout.desc: Scouts explore new areas, allowing you to expand your territory. They can also explore Ruins and Shipwrecks.

Healer.name: Healer
Healer.desc: Healers gather medicinal herbs that your wounded will use to heal themselves. The wounded must be within your territory to heal.

Mender.name: Mender
Mender.desc: Menders heal wounded Vikings within your territory and gather [Lore] when not otherwise busy.

Smith.name: Smith
Smith.desc: Only an experienced Smith can forge the legendary Sword of Odin.

Warrior.name: Warrior
Warrior.desc: Warriors are the most common [Warband] units. They are good fighters with an advantage against Shield Bearers.
Warrior.flavor: Fun fact: Viking warriors did not wear horned helmets. This depiction originates from the 1876 rendition of Wagner's Der Ring des Nibelungen.

ShieldBearer.name: Shield Bearer
ShieldBearer.desc: Shield Bearers are a strong defensive unit that take ::inv_percent:: less damage from ranged units and watchtowers.

AxeWielder.name: Axe Thrower
AxeWielder.desc: Axe Throwers are ranged units that are more powerful than the average warrior but a bit more fragile.

Skirmisher.name: Skirmisher
Skirmisher.desc: Skirmishers are lightweight military units that trade offense and protection for mobility and stealth.
Skirmisher.flavor: When you see them, it's probably too late.

Hero01.name: Warchief
Hero01.desc: Warchiefs are experienced units that bring their strength and leadership to bear in combat.

Hero02.name: Warchief
Hero02.desc: Warchiefs are experienced units that bring their strength and leadership to bear in combat.

Hero03.name: Warchief
Hero03.desc: Warchiefs are experienced units that bring their strength and leadership to bear in combat.

Hero04.name: Warchief
Hero04.desc: Warchiefs are experienced units that bring their strength and leadership to bear in combat.

Berserker.name: Berserker
Berserker.desc: A powerful and reckless warrior, feared by all enemies of the Wolf Clan.

Maiden.name: Shield Maiden
Maiden.desc: Stalwart defender of her people, she is the reason the Bear Clan will never falter.

WarchiefSnake.name: Signy
WarchiefSnake.desc: A shadowy leader with no regard for morals, Signy will stop at nothing to make a mark on Northgard.
WarchiefSnake.flavor: The Snake will soon sink its fangs in Northgard!

GiantHero.name: Bláinn
GiantHero.desc: Bláinn is a legendary [Giant] who decided to befriend humans and lend them his unrivaled strength.

Mercenary.name: Mercenary
Mercenary.desc: Hired for [Money], Mercenaries are not always reliable, but they'll wreak havoc on any territory they attack.

Berserker03.name: Egil
Berserker03.desc: A ruthless and impetuous young berserker, Egil, bannerman of the Wolf Clan, is in it mostly for the mayhem.

Maiden02.name: Borgild
Maiden02.desc: Brave and arrogant, Borgild, bannermaiden of the Bear Clan, is a tough woman who bows to no one and shows little mercy for the weakhearted.

Maiden03.name: Liv
Maiden03.desc: Ambitious and pragmatic, Liv, the cunning bannermaiden of the Raven Clan, likes to control every parameter of a situation and hates wasting time or Kröwns on futile pursuits.
Maiden03.flavor: The end always justifies the means.

Hero06.name: Halvard
Hero06.desc: Halvard, the elderly bannerman of the Goat Clan, is a wise and kind-hearted man focused on the survival of his people.

Hero07.name: Brand
Hero07.desc: Proud and noble at heart, Brand, bannerman of the Stag Clan, is a loyal man who lives and fights with honor.
Hero07.flavor: May our victories be sung for centuries!

Hero08.name: Svarn
Hero08.desc: The taciturn Svarn, spiritual leader of the Boar Clan rebels, is both a sage and a warrior who lives a simple life, close to Nature and in accordance with the Old Ways.
Hero08.flavor: I can... FEEL your presence. Yes... YOURS.

Hero05.name: Hagen
Hero05.desc: The shady leader of the Raven Clan and murderer of your father. Although fierce and merciless, he tends to act cowardly when things turn sour.
Hero05.flavor: Fight for me and ye'll be rich!

Berserker02.name: Hvedrung
Berserker02.desc: The mysterious leader of the Boar Clan, hellbent on bringing about Ragnarök. His actions were somehow foretold by the Runes. Some believe he is not a mere mortal.
Berserker02.flavor: I shall be "the villain" if it makes things more comprehensible for your feeble mind. And yes: I know you are reading this.

Death.name: Draugr
Death.desc: Draugar are half-dead evil creatures that have infested the islands of Northgard.
Death.flavor: Only the most nefarious and greediest human beings turn into Draugar when they die.

Giant.name: Jötunn
Giant.desc: Ancient creatures from the Dark Ages, Jötnar are peaceful until you attack them. If you do, brace yourself!
Giant.flavor: Ymir, the primitive giant, is said to be the father of all giants and dwarves.

UndeadGiant.name: Draugr Jötunn
UndeadGiant.desc: Jötnar aren't immune to becoming Draugar.
UndeadGiant.flavor: Your undead problems are now available in extra-large.

GiantFire.name: Eldthurs
GiantFire.desc: The "sons of Muspell" are hellbent on destroying the world. They will wreak as much havoc as they can before burning away, as they can't survive outside of their homeworld.

Kobold.name: Kobold
Kobold.desc: Kobolds can be a great trade partner, but also an annoyance when they take valuable land.

Wolf.name: Wolf
Wolf.desc: Vicious giant wolves roam the lands of Northgard. They will not hesitate to attack humans.

Bear.name: Brown Bear
Bear.desc: Solitary creatures that fiercely defend their territory. They'll prove challenging to even the most seasoned warriors.

BearMaiden.name: Kaija, the Armored Bear
BearMaiden.desc: Kaija is a powerful defensive unit that cannot enter enemy territory.

Wyvern.name: Wyvern
Wyvern.desc: The most fearsome of the ancient creatures roaming the lands of Northgard.

Valkyrie.name: Valkyrie
Valkyrie.desc: Originally champions of the gods, some Valkyries have been corrupted by the powers of Helheim.
Valkyrie.flavor: "Valkyrie" means "chooser of the slain," as they decide which fallen warriors will join Odin in Valhöll.

IceWorm.name: Hrímgandr
IceWorm.desc: A giant, near-invincible rime serpent living mostly underground. Only the Wurmslayer can make a dent in its diamond-hard icy scales.
IceWorm.flavor: Said to be the spawn of Jörmungandr, imbued with Niflheim's fumes.

Sheep.name: Sheep
Sheep.desc: Having at least one Sheep in an area reduces the need for Firewood by ::percent:: during winter for this area.
Sheep.flavor: Clicking this Sheep repeatedly is guaranteed to be 100% safe.

Vedrfolnir.name: Vedrfolnir
Vedrfolnir.desc: Vedrfolnir has been hurt. Once healed, he will scout certain areas for your clan. You will also gain 100 [Lore].
Vedrfolnir.flavor: Vedrfolnir is a hawk usually sitting between the eyes of the giant eagle perched atop Yggdrasil.

Group.name: Group
Group.desc: Click to select a specific job among the group:

House.name: House
House.desc: Provides shelter for more clan members.
House.upgrade.desc: Can shelter ::value:: additional clan members and improve housing quality.

ScoutCamp.name: Scout Camp
ScoutCamp.desc: Train your villagers to become [Scout]s who can explore new areas.
ScoutCamp.flavor: Empty for the greater part of the year.
ScoutCamp.upgrade.desc: Increase all your [Scout]s' scouting speed by ::percent::.

WoodLodge.name: Woodcutter's Lodge
WoodLodge.desc: Train your villagers to become [Woodcutter]s who can harvest Wood in this area.

HealerHut.name: Healer's Hut
HealerHut.desc: Train your villagers to become [Healer]s who will heal your wounded or sick clan members in your territory.

MenderHut.name: Mender's Hut
MenderHut.desc: Train your villagers to become [Mender]s who will heal your wounded or sick clan members in your territory.

FishermanHouse.name: Fisherman's Hut
FishermanHouse.desc: Train your villagers to become [Fisherman]s who will produce [Food] even during winter.

Fields.name: Fields
Fields.desc: Train your villagers to become [Farmer]s who will produce [Food] in larger quantities during summer.

HunterLodge.name: Hunter's Lodge
HunterLodge.desc: Train your villagers to become [Hunter]s who will track and kill deer.

FoodSilo.name: Food Silo
FoodSilo.desc: Improves [Food] produced by specialized workers in this area by ::percent::. Increases your maximum food storage.
FoodSilo.upgrade.desc: Improves [Food] produced in this area by ::percent::.

TradingPost.name: Trading Post
TradingPost.desc: Train your villagers to become [Merchant]s who will earn [Money]s.

MarketPlace.name: Marketplace
MarketPlace.desc: Train your villagers to become [Merchant]s and spend [Money] to buy various resources.

RavenPort.name: Harbor
RavenPort.desc: Sailors loot [Money] and [Lore] or [Fame] while raiding. You can scout shores and hire [Mercenary]s. Add a [Lighthouse] to exploit Great Trade Routes.

Port.name: Longship Dock
Port.desc: Sailors loot [Money] and [Lore] or [Fame] while raiding. Add a [Lighthouse] to exploit Great Trade Routes.
Port.props.noFameDesc: Sailors loot [Money] and [Lore] while raiding. Add a [Lighthouse] to exploit Great Trade Routes.

HallOfPoetry.name: Hall of Skalds
HallOfPoetry.desc: Train your villagers to become [Skald]s who will increase your clan's [Fame] and [Happy].

Tavern.name: Brewery
Tavern.desc: Train your villagers to become [InnKeeper]s who will increase your clan's [Happy].

Sheepfold.name: Sheepfold
Sheepfold.desc: Allows you to enclose your [Sheep] to produce [Food].
Sheepfold.flavor: Better than slaughtering the poor things, right?
Sheepfold.upgrade.desc: Allows you to assign one more [Sheep]. They produce ::percent:: more [Food].

TrainingCamp.name: Training Camp
TrainingCamp.desc: Allows you to recruit military units and increases your [Warband] size.
TrainingCamp.upgrade.desc: Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [Warrior]s' attack by 5%.

SkirmishCenter.name: Skirmisher Camp
SkirmishCenter.desc: Allows you to recruit [Skirmisher]s. Increases your [Warband] size.
SkirmishCenter.upgrade.desc: Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [Skirmisher]s' attack by 5%.

AxeCenter.name: Axe Thrower Camp
AxeCenter.desc: Allows you to recruit [AxeWielder]s, powerful ranged units, and increases your [Warband] size.
AxeCenter.upgrade.desc: Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [AxeWielder]s' attack by 5%.

ShieldCenter.name: Shield Bearer Camp
ShieldCenter.desc: Allows you to recruit [ShieldBearer]s, which are well protected against ranged units and towers, and increases your [Warband] size.
ShieldCenter.upgrade.desc: Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [ShieldBearer]s' attack by 5%.

WatchTower.name: Defense Tower
WatchTower.desc: Protects this area from enemies by shooting at them.
WatchTower.upgrade.desc: Increases the tower's attack and resistance by ::percent::.

AllMines.name: Mine
AllMines.desc: Train your villagers to become [Miner]s to extract stone or iron from deposits.

Mine.name: Quarry
Mine.desc: Train your villagers to become [Miner]s who will quarry [Stone].

IronMine.name: Iron Mine
IronMine.desc: Train your villagers to become [Miner]s who will extract [Iron] ore.

RimeSteelMine.name: Rimesteel Mine
RimeSteelMine.desc: Train your villagers to become [Miner]s who will extract [RimeSteel] ore.

CarvedStone.name: Carved Stone
CarvedStone.desc: Train a villager to become a [RuneMaster] who will produce [Lore].
CarvedStone.flavor: Quite a bit heavier than a book.

Temple.name: Altar of Kings
Temple.desc: The Altar of Kings provides +::value::$icon(Food) +::value::$icon(Wood) +::value::$icon(Money) +::value::$icon(Lore) production as well as +50[Fame]
Temple.props.noFameDesc: The Altar of Kings provides +::value::$icon(Food) +::value::$icon(Wood) +::value::$icon(Money) +::value::$icon(Lore) production

Lighthouse.name: Lighthouse
Lighthouse.desc: Allows you to create Great Routes. Must be built on a [Port].

RavenLighthouse.name: Lighthouse
RavenLighthouse.desc: Allows you to create Great Routes. Must be built on a [RavenPort].

Forge.name: Forge
Forge.desc: Train your villagers to become [Smith]s. Allows you to forge the Sword of Odin.

TownHall.name: Town Hall
TownHall.desc: Spawns new [Villager]s when you have enough [Happy].
TownHall.upgrade.desc: Allows you to upgrade other buildings. Increases maximum [Population] by 2 and population growth by ::percent::.

RuneStone.name: Runestone
RuneStone.desc: Train a villager to become a [RuneMaster] who will produce [Lore].

CircleStone.name: Circle of Stones
CircleStone.desc: Train your villagers to become [RuneMaster]s. All Loremasters in this area will produce ::percent:: more [Lore].

Stones.name: Stones
Stones.desc: You can build a mine here to extract [Stone].

Fertility.name: Fertile Land
Fertility.desc: You can build [Fields] here and recruit [Farmer]s.
Fertility.flavor: A little gift from Gefjon, the goddess of plowing.

DeathCamp.name: Draugr Tombs
DeathCamp.desc: [Death]s will rise from this place until you take control of it.

Ruins.name: Ruins
Ruins.desc: Treasure is waiting to be found here, but only [Scout]s will have the courage to venture there. Colonize first to explore.

IronDeposit.name: Iron Deposit
IronDeposit.desc: You can build an Iron Mine here to extract [Iron] ore.

RimeSteelDeposit.name: Rimesteel Deposit
RimeSteelDeposit.desc: You can build a Mine here to extract [RimeSteel] ore.
RimeSteelDeposit.flavor: A mysterious metal found only in the coldest environments. Said to be the only material that can pierce an [IceWorm]'s shell.

WolvesCave.name: Wolf Den
WolvesCave.desc: [Wolf]s will spawn in this area until you claim it.

Grove.name: Forest
Grove.desc: Improves [Wood] production in this area by ::percent::.
Grove.flavor: At Yule, Vikings would traditionally decorate large evergreen trees with carvings, gifts and food, urging spring to return faster.

DeerSpawner.name: Deer
DeerSpawner.desc: This area is full of deer, making it a great place to hunt.

MarshBuilding.name: Swamp
MarshBuilding.desc: Unstable ground makes it harder to build in this area.

BrokenShores.name: Shipwreck
BrokenShores.desc: Colonize and use your [Scout]s to explore this wreck, where you will find [Money] and [Wood].

GiantCamp.name: Jötunn Camp
GiantCamp.desc: [Giant]s are usually peaceful... Trade enough [Food] with them and they might join you.

KoboldHouse.name: Kobold Camp
KoboldHouse.desc: Kobolds will spawn here and in nearby territories.

DraugrPortal.name: Draugr Portal
DraugrPortal.desc: [Death]s will soon come pouring through this portal. We must prepare!

ThorWrath.name: Thor's Wrath
ThorWrath.desc: An ancient place of power. Gives +5% attack bonus to military units.

Geyser.name: Geyser
Geyser.desc: A warm and pleasant area. Gives +1[Happy] and -10% [Wood] consumption in winter if controlled.

BrokenHouse.name: Damaged House
BrokenHouse.desc: Colonize and use your [Scout]s to explore this house, where you will find [Money] and [Wood].

Bifrost.name: Bifröst
Bifrost.desc: The legendary bridge that leads to Asgard, where the major gods, the Æsir, are said to live. Protect it at all costs!
Bifrost.flavor: "Bifröst" is believed to mean "shimmering path." The bridge is also called "Asbru," the Æsir's bridge.

Muspell.name: Gate of Muspell
Muspell.desc: This gateway connects Northgard and Muspelheim, the realm of fire. [GiantFire]s will spawn here until someone is brave enough to seal it.
Muspell.flavor: Muspelheim is the southernmost of the nine worlds supported by the world tree Yggdrasil.

Yggdrasil.name: Yggdrasil
Yggdrasil.desc: The world tree is threatened by evil forces.

BigSword.name: Relic of the Gods
BigSword.desc: Train your villagers to become [RuneMaster]s. All Loremasters in this area will produce ::percent:: more [Lore].

Helheim.name: Gates of Helheim
Helheim.desc: This portal connects Northgard to Helheim, the realm of the dead. Corrupted [Valkyrie]s will spawn here until someone is brave enough to confront them.

MagmaFlow.name: Magma Flow
MagmaFlow.desc: The magma in this area can be used to craft very powerful weapons.

Lumber.name: Sharp Axes
Lumber.desc: Your Woodcutters will produce ::percent:: more Wood.

Weaponsmith.name: Weaponsmith
Weaponsmith.desc: Increases all your military units' attack power by ::percent::.

ImprovedHall.name: Trading
ImprovedHall.desc: Gain +::value::[Money] production. Enables Trade Routes with [TradingPost]s and Great Trade Routes with a [Lighthouse].

Colonize.name: Colonization
Colonize.desc: Reduces the amount of [Food] necessary to colonize one area by ::inv_percent::.

Coats.name: Fur Coats
Coats.desc: Your units no longer have reduced power during winter.

Defense.name: Defensive Strategy
Defense.desc: Increases your civilians' attack and your Defense Towers' resistance by ::percent::.

Recruit.name: Recruitment
Recruit.desc: Increases population growth speed by ::percent::. +50% during 6 months when one of your unit is killed by an enemy.

Medecine.name: Medicine
Medecine.desc: Increases your [Healer]s' healing speed by ::percent::. Healers will gather food when they are not healing.

MilitaryStrategy.name: Military Strategy
MilitaryStrategy.desc: Military units gain +::percent:: attack for each type of friendly military unit in the area.

Security.name: Feeling Safe
Security.desc: Gain +::value::[Happy] if you have a [Hero01] and +1[Happy] per upgraded military camp.

Knowledge.name: Erudition
Knowledge.desc: Increases [RuneMaster] production by ::percent::. Cost of Carved Stones is halved.

Upgrades.name: Carpentry Mastery
Upgrades.desc: Reduces your buildings' upgrade costs by ::inv_percent::.

HeartStone.name: Hearthstone
HeartStone.desc: Reduces extra Firewood consumption during winter by ::inv_percent::.

Heroes.name: Legendary Heroes
Heroes.desc: Improves your [Hero01]'s attack and defense by ::percent::.

MonsterSlayer.name: Monster Slayer
MonsterSlayer.desc: Improves your military units' attack by ::percent:: against mystical creatures.

Ascetic.name: Field Rations
Ascetic.desc: Reduces your military units' [Food] consumption by ::inv_percent::.

Pillage.name: Spoils of War
Pillage.desc: Gain +::value::[Money] for each enemy unit killed.

Plunder.name: Plunder
Plunder.desc: When you decolonize an area, your units there gain +::percent:: health.

Conqueror.name: Conqueror
Conqueror.desc: Increases your military power against Defense Towers by ::percent::, and makes decolonization twice as fast.

Threats.name: Veiled Threats
Threats.desc: Improves your Trade Routes' [Money] income by ::percent:: if you have a [Hero01]. Relations with other clans don't affect Trade Routes.

MoreAssign.name: Industrious
MoreAssign.desc: Food-producing buildings can be assigned an additional villager if they are upgraded.

MoreBuildings.name: Amenities
MoreBuildings.desc: Costs ::inv_percent:: less to add a building slot to an area.

Barricades.name: Barricades
Barricades.desc: Increases your civilians' resistance by ::percent:: per building in the area.

FoodTrade.name: Food Trade
FoodTrade.desc: Trading food increases your Trade Routes' [Money] income by ::percent::.

BetterSilo.name: Eradication
BetterSilo.desc: Silos gain a ::percent:: [Food] production bonus and you gain +1[Happy] per Silo. Also reduce [FoodSilo] upgrade cost by 50%.

BuildingUpkeep.name: Advanced Silos
BuildingUpkeep.desc: Increases [Food] production by +2 for each Silo (+::value:: if upgraded).

ProudStag.name: Young and Proud
ProudStag.desc: Increases your military units' attack power by ::percent:: for every positive [Happy] you have (currently ::nb::% - 25% max).

GreatDeeds.name: The Value of Great Deeds
GreatDeeds.desc: Skalds will produce +::value::[Money] (+2 if their building is upgraded).

Rangers.name: Rangers
Rangers.desc: Increases scouting and exploration speed by ::percent::. Your Scouts no longer consume [Food] and cannot be hurt while exploring.

GreatRoutes.name: Improved Trade Routes
GreatRoutes.desc: Increases your Trade Routes' [Money] income and marketplace supply by ::percent::.

MilitaryFunds.name: Gear Upgrade
MilitaryFunds.desc: Increases your military units' attack power depending on your [Money] in stock (currently ::nb::% - 25% max).

GreatExplorers.name: Journeymen
GreatExplorers.desc: Increases your [Happy] based on the areas you have explored.

Hibernate.name: Hibernation
Hibernate.desc: Your non-sick clan members will heal during winter when in your territory.

LandProtect.name: Protector of the Land
LandProtect.desc: Gain +1[Happy] per area with at least one military camp.

ShieldMaster.name: Shield Mastery
ShieldMaster.desc: [ShieldBearer]s cost less [Money], and their resistance is increased by ::percent::.

Harpoons.name: Harpoons
Harpoons.desc: Fisherman's Huts can have one more [Fisherman], and their production is increased by ::percent::.

WinterFestival.name: Winter Festival
WinterFestival.desc: During winter, [Food] production loss is reduced by ::inv_percent:: and [Happy] is increased by 3.

Bartering.name: Bartering
Bartering.desc: +1[Money] for each ::value:: clan member. Enables Trade Routes with neutral factions from [TradingPost]s. Also enables Great Trade Routes with a [Lighthouse].

Herbalism.name: Herbalism
Herbalism.desc: Each active [Mender] provides +::percent:: production in [MenderHut] territory.

BlackMarket.name: Black Market
BlackMarket.desc:
[Merchant]s produce +10% more [Money].
Gain +::percent:: [Money] when trading with enemy clan, degrading diplomatic relations. You can trade even when at war. Enemy clans get no resources from black market trading.

Guerilla.name: Guerilla Tactics
Guerilla.desc: Military units have +::percent:: atk per civilian killed (currently ::nb::% - 40% max, ::nb2:: /20 killed)

Rapacious.name: Rapacious Exploitation
Rapacious.desc:
Bonus of special tiles is doubled.
Ruins and shipwreck grant +::value::[Happy]

UnderPressure.name: Under Pressure
UnderPressure.desc:
You gain +::value:: [Happy] and +::value:: [Food] for each enemy clan with your military units near or inside their frontiers.
Increase [Skirmisher]s attack by 20%

GotBerserk.name: Dominion
GotBerserk.desc: Your [Berserker] can colonize cleared areas for free.

MilitaryWolf.name: Assault
MilitaryWolf.desc: Your military units gain a ::percent:: attack bonus when fighting outside your territory. [Berserker]'s Dominion cooldown is reduced by 50%

FreeTools.name: Spare Tools
FreeTools.desc: You gain ::value:: free tools to improve your villagers' productivity.

FeastResist.name: Teamwork
FeastResist.desc: You gain one free feast. Your Defense Towers and all your military units gain ::percent:: resistance when feasting.

Dedication.name: Dedication
Dedication.desc: Upgraded buildings gain an additional ::percent:: production bonus.

Mercenaries.name: Mercenaries
Mercenaries.desc: You can hire [Mercenary]s at your [RavenPort] and send them to raid coastal areas.

KindredSpirit.name: Kindred Spirit
KindredSpirit.desc: Having [BearMaiden] or a [Maiden] in an area increases local production by ::percent::.

BearAwake.name: The Bear Awakens
BearAwake.desc: You gain +::value::[Fame] per enemy unit killed in an area with the [Maiden]. Your military units gain +1% power per 100 [Fame].

OldKnowledge.name: Heritage
OldKnowledge.desc: +::value:: free Knowledge (does not count toward a Lore victory or Blessing unlock).

GreaterBlessings.name: Greater Blessings
GreaterBlessings.desc:
Freya: Blizzard penalty is massively reduced (50%)
Baldr: +5[Happy]
Jörd: Warchief and upgraded towers get +10% Attack

PrideSnake.name: Pride of the Clan
PrideSnake.desc: [WarchiefSnake] gains 20% move speed and can now attack at range.

ScorchedEarth.name: Scorched Earth
ScorchedEarth.desc:
[WarchiefSnake] can use [ScorchedEarth] to burn an empty or enemy zone during 3 months (3 month cooldown).
Burned zone : -50% production, snakes units and buildings +50% att.
[WarchiefSnake] can go through tiles with foes without engaging combat.

Cartography.name: DEPRECATED
Cartography.desc: You explore areas controlled by another clan ::percent:: faster.

SharpWeapons.name: DEPRECATED
SharpWeapons.desc: Increases your military units' attack power by ::percent::.

FreyaBlessing.name: Freya's Blessing
FreyaBlessing.desc: Reduces loss of [Food] production during winter by ::inv_percent::.

FinalBlessing.name: Ancestral Knowledge
FinalBlessing.desc: Required to achieve a Wisdom victory.

Wolf.name: Wolf
Wolf.title: The Clan of the Wolf
Wolf.desc: Aggressive, protective of their freedom, and more than a little reckless. They are well prepared to face the dangers of Northgard and use their combined might and mobility to leave little chance to all but the most resilient.
Wolf.bonuses: <0> Killing [Wolf]s and [Bear]s provides [Meat]. </0> <1> Your military units consume ::inv_percent:: less Food and provide [Happy]. </1>

Stag.name: Stag
Stag.title: The Clan of the Stag
Stag.desc: Proud of their legacy of astonishing achievements, they are renowned as much for their honorable and regal manner as for their harsh justice and unyielding strength. Valuing wealth and fame, they are highly ambitious expansionists.
Stag.bonuses: <0> You start with +::value::[Food], [Wood] and [Money]. </0> <1> The Hall of [Skald]s replaces the Brewery and produces additional [Fame]. </1>

Goat.name: Goat
Goat.title: The Clan of the Goat
Goat.desc: When it comes to surviving in dangerous conditions and building sturdy settlements, the Goat Clan has no rival. They will endure and survive no matter what.
Goat.bonuses: <0> Starts with one [Sheep] and can build the [Sheepfold]. </0> <1> Increases the production bonus of your feasts to ::percent::. </1>

Raven.name: Raven
Raven.title: The Clan of the Raven
Raven.desc: Great explorers and merchants, their mighty fleet allowed them to be the first to land on Northgard. They are strong trade partners if you don’t mind their constant scheming. Brash and swift, they will often be found roaming where you least expect them.
Raven.bonuses: <0> Can colonize with [Money] instead of [Food]. </0> <1> Can build the [RavenPort] to explore coastal areas and later send [Mercenary]s to attack. </1>

Bear.name: Bear
Bear.title: The Clan of the Bear
Bear.desc: Stalwart protectors of the land, the Bjarki clan claims the most resilient warriors. Hailing from the northern reaches of the realm, they are also very well equipped to survive the harsh winters of Northgard.
Bear.bonuses: <0> Food and Firewood penalties in winter are reduced by ::inv_percent::. </0> <1> You can summon [BearMaiden] to your training camp. </1> <2> Instead of having reduced power, your military units gain ::percent:: resistance bonus during the winter. </2>

Boar.name: Boar
Boar.title: The Clan of the Boar
Boar.desc: A reclusive bunch forgotten by the other clans and recently rediscovered, the Boar Clan is both mystical and untamed. Their understanding of the world is unmatched, as are their boorish and primitive ways.
Boar.bonuses: <0> The [Mender]'s Hut replaces the Healer's Hut. Menders produce +::value::[Lore] while not healing. </0> <1> Each additional territory gives ::value:: max population. </1> <2> No penalties to [Happy] for non-upgraded houses. </2>

Snake.name: Snake
Snake.title: The Clan of the Snake
Snake.desc: Cunning and deceitful, the Snake has little regard for fame or honour. Members of the clan prefer working in the shadows and using guerilla tactics rather than open warfare.
Snake.bonuses: <0> You start with your warchief, the young Signy. </0> <1> Iron is not needed to summon Signy. </1> <2> The clan doesn't have access to Fame. Signy grows up, getting stronger and unlocking new abilities instead. </2>

Wounded.desc: Wounded clan members have ::inv_percent:: reduced production.

NotHappy.desc: Unhappy clan members have ::inv_percent:: reduced production.

WinterMalus.desc: Your military units have ::inv_percent:: reduced power during winter outside your territory and 10% inside your territory.

FarFromHome.desc: Your military units have up to ::inv_percent:: reduced power depending on their distance from your territory.

Blizzard.name: Blizzard
Blizzard.announce: The weather is cold this year. We'll have a Blizzard this winter, so we need to store a large amount of [Food] and [Wood]!
Blizzard.desc: Reduces all production by ::inv_percent:: and doubles Firewood consumption.

Rats.name: Rat Infestation
Rats.announce: Rats have been reported. We need to store our [Food] in Silos and have [Healer]s to protect against disease.
Rats.desc: Rats will devour ::percent_value:: of any [Food] not stored in Silos and bring disease. Your Silos currently protect ::silo::.

Earthquake.name: Earthquake
Earthquake.announce: Tremors have been reported. A big earthquake would seriously damage our buildings unless we store [Wood] to repair them.
Earthquake.desc: The earthquake will damage some of your buildings.

DraugrAttack.name: Draugar Invasion
DraugrAttack.announce: Portals leading to Helheim have opened. We need to take defensive action before the [Death]s arrive!
DraugrAttack.desc: [Death]s will soon spawn from the portals.

Unfreeze.name: Spring
Unfreeze.announce: The undead army will unfreeze and attack you at the beginning of the 5th summer. We must prepare to survive!
Unfreeze.desc: The undead army will unfreeze and attack you at the beginning of the 5th summer. We must prepare to survive!

FoodRequest.name: Food Request
FoodRequest.announce: Svarn requests a supply of ::value:: [Food] to survive. Help him and you will get some [Fame] and a [Happy] bonus until the next request.
FoodRequest.desc: Spare Svarn some [Food] as soon as you can afford to. Should you fail to provide the supplies in time, the rebels will have more trouble resisting the loyalists' assaults.

WoodRequest.name: Wood Request
WoodRequest.announce: Svarn requests a supply of ::value:: [Wood] to heat the clan's homes and repair their structures. Help him and you will get some [Fame] and a [Happy] bonus until the next request.
WoodRequest.desc: Spare Svarn some [Wood] as soon as you can afford to. Should you fail to provide the supplies in time, the rebels will have more trouble resisting the loyalists' assaults.

MoneyRequest.name: Kröwn Request
MoneyRequest.announce: Svarn requests a supply of ::value:: [Money]s to help maintain the clan's troops. Help him and you will get some [Fame] and a [Happy] bonus until the next request.
MoneyRequest.desc: Spare Svarn some [Money]s as soon as you can afford to. Should you fail to provide the supplies in time, the rebels will have more trouble resisting the loyalists' assaults.

GiantAttack.name: Attack of Giants
GiantAttack.announce: Our enemy will be sending [Giant]s to crush us. We should brace for an assault of epic proportions.
GiantAttack.desc: We should prepare appropriately to resist the next assault; [Giant]s pack quite a punch!

BifrostEvent.name: Gjallarhorn's Wail
BifrostEvent.announce: Hvedrung is calling the fierce Fire Giants from Muspell to destroy Bifröst.
BifrostEvent.desc: Prepare to protect Bifröst and yourself from the Fire Giants.

IceWormAttack.name: Hrímgandr's Wrath
IceWormAttack.desc: Hrímgandr will wreak havoc in your territory.

HagenReinforcement.name: Search Party
HagenReinforcement.announce: ::value:: month(s) before Hagen's search party arrives.
HagenReinforcement.desc: Mercenaries will land on your coasts soon.

Betrayal.name: Tragedy
Betrayal.cinematic: <0> I am Rig, son of the High King Hargurorf, and this is my saga. </0> <1> It all began... one fateful day... </1> <2> My father had gathered all his Jarls to make an announcement of the utmost importance. </2> <3> We were to embark for the wondrous lands of Northgard; riches, conquest and glory awaited us on this mysterious new continent. </3> <4> But the Norns had other plans for us... </4> <5> Dozens of armed men suddenly poured into the Hall and put an abrupt end to our ambitions... and to our lives. </5> <6> They were mercenaries led by a man named Hagen, from the Clan of the Raven. </6> <7> In a matter of minutes, we were all slaughtered like sheep. </7> <8> All… but me. Barely conscious and vastly outnumbered, I had no way to fight back, so I feigned death. </8> <9> I seethed as he stole the map of Northgard and ripped the Regal Horn from my father's throne, a family heirloom and the very symbol of our royalty. </9> <10> I had to avenge my father... and reclaim my kinghood! </10>

Journey.name: Exodus
Journey.desc: We have safely escaped to a remote region. We must now reach the shores of Northgard.
Journey.objectives: <0 id="mShore"> Reach the shore to the north. </0> <1 id="mPort"> Build a [Port]. </1> <2 id="bFood"> Acquire a minimum of ::value:: [Food]. </2> <3 id="bRuin"> Explore all the abandoned houses. </3> <4 id="bYear"> Build the [Port] before Year ::value::. </4>
Journey.cinematic: <0> I had no strength left when I encountered a group of runaways of the Stag Clan led by a proud young man named Brand. </0> <1> Hagen's men had set his town aflame and he had nothing left, not even his father, the clan's Jarl, who had died at the hands of the fiend just like mine. </1> <2> Our common enemy had sailed for Northgard, of which he now had a map. All I could think about was finding him to avenge my father and retrieve the Regal Horn. </2>
Journey.texts: <0 id="start1" who="Brand"> Glad to see you back on your feet, my lord. I'm surprised at how fast you recovered. </0> <1 id="start2" who="Rig"> I suppose rage is an excellent healer. Still, we've wasted enough time already. We must go after Hagen as soon as possible. </1> <2 id="start3" who="Brand"> Indeed, time is of the essence. Our camp is far from the enemy, but we are marooned in an unknown province on the outskirts of your kingdom. </2> <3 id="start4" who="Rig"> I shall prove myself worthy of their trust. However impatient I am to get even with that scum, my priority is to ensure their survival. </3> <4 id="start5" who="Brand"> Very good. Your restraint does you honor. Besides, none of us will be getting revenge if we starve to death first. </4> <5 id="start6" who="Brand"> Speaking of which, there will be no shortage of mouths to feed, so let us seek out food. Wood is also a vital resource, being used for both heating and construction. </5> <6 id="start7" who="Rig"> We must also leave the continent and set sail for Northgard. We shall need a proper shore to go out to sea. </6> <7 id="start8" who="Brand"> You are quite right. I suggest you instruct villagers to build a scout camp and train as scouts, so that they may explore the region. </7> <8 id="winter1" who="Rig"> Hmm, the air is getting colder... winter is almost upon us. </8> <9 id="winter2" who="Brand"> Indeed, my lord. We should expect food to be scarcer, and our people will consume more firewood to heat their homes. </9> <10 id="winter3" who="Rig"> Our military troops will also be weakened by the cold. It might not be the best time to fight. </10> <11 id="house1" who="Brand"> My lord, reconnaissance of the area has revealed an abandoned cottage. </11> <12 id="house2" who="Rig"> Perhaps we should order a scout to search it. They might be able to salvage some resources. </12> <13 id="house3" who="Brand"> Agreed. We will have to colonize the area before they can explore the ruins, however. </13> <14 id="harbor1" who="Brand"> My lord, one scout claims to have found a suitable coast for the construction of a port. </14> <15 id="harbor2" who="Rig"> Excellent. We should colonize the area leading up to this shore so that our builders can reach it and get to work. </15> <16 id="end1" who="Brand"> At last! Thanks to your efforts, our clan can now put out to sea. </16> <17 id="end2" who="Rig"> Anchors aweigh, proud Vikings! We sail for Northgard! </17> <18 id="end3" who="Rig"> Your end draws near, Hagen. </18>
Journey.tutorial: <0 id="title"> Getting Started </0> <1 id="sentence1"> You are in a safe, remote area. Your goal here is to meet the basic survival needs of your clan: [Food], [Wood] and [House]s. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> Be sure to train [Scout]s so that they can explore the region, and then expand your territory by colonizing nearby areas. Find a shore to embark in search of undiscovered lands. </2>

Foothold.name: Foothold
Foothold.desc: Northgard is a harsh continent. We must tame these lands, lest we be forgotten by history.
Foothold.objectives: <0 id="mTerritory"> Colonize ::value:: territories. </0> <1 id="mFame"> Reach ::value:: [Fame]. </1> <2 id="mGoat"> Send your military units to kill all [Wolf]s around Halvard's settlement. </2> <3 id="bHappy"> Reach ::value:: [Happy]. </3> <4 id="bWolf"> Destroy all [WolvesCave]s. </4> <5 id="bTrade"> Trade [Food] and [Wood] with Halvard via 2 Trade Routes for at least ::value:: month(s) each. </5>
Foothold.cinematic: <0> My companions' eyes were shining with ambition; they were eager to set foot on the untamed lands of Northgard and reap its wonders. </0> <1> But my heart was tormented by a darker appetite. </1> <2> Vengeance. </2>
Foothold.texts: <0 id="start0" who="Rig"> Land ho! Finally, we set foot on Northgard! </0> <1 id="start1" who="Brand"> My lord, we have dismantled our longships and used the scrap lumber to build a town hall on the shore. </1> <2 id="start2" who="Rig"> There is no turning back now. Thank you for your dedication. </2> <3 id="start3" who="Brand"> We await your orders to claim the region and expand our clan. </3> <4 id="start4" who="Rig"> There is much to be done. We must colonize the surrounding area to expand our living space and find resources... </4> <5 id="start5" who="Rig"> ...and we need to raise our fame if we hope to stake a rightful claim to the region. </5> <6 id="start6" who="Brand"> Please stay safe and lead us to victory, my lord! </6> <7 id="draugr1" who="Brand"> What is this wretched creature? </7> <8 id="draugr2" who="Rig"> Could that be... a draugr? </8> <9 id="draugr3" who="Rig"> I have heard old men's tales of undead warriors, but I never gave them much credit. Apparently I was wrong. </9> <10 id="draugr4" who="Brand"> At any rate, we should defend our people and slay this fiendish abomination! </10> <11 id="mine1" who="Brand"> We just discovered a mineral deposit. These come in two types: stone and iron ore. </11> <12 id="mine2" who="Brand"> Both are important resources, and both can be extracted by miners. Build a mine to train them. </12> <13 id="mine3" who="Brand"> Stone can be used to improve our buildings. Iron allows us to make our tools better, as well as to rearm a bannerman–such as myself–if they should fall in battle. </13> <14 id="mine4" who="Brand"> Keep in mind that a deposit is finite and typically holds little ore. Be sure to make good use of it. </14> <15 id="goatAppear1" who="Brand"> My lord, we have encountered another clan. What shall we do? </15> <16 id="goatAppear2" who="Rig"> Are they with that scum Hagen? </16> <17 id="goatAppear3" who="Halvard"> We come in peace! I am Halvard of Heidrun, the Goat Clan. We mean you no harm! Please offer us assistance! </17> <18 id="goatAppear4" who="Rig"> Greetings, Halvard of Heidrun. I am Rig, son of the late High King Hargurorf. What ails you? </18> <19 id="goatAppear5" who="Halvard"> My deepest condolences, my young lord. We too have lost much of late. </19> <20 id="goatAppear6" who="Halvard"> Our journey went awry and... well, to be brief, we are now shipwrecked on a desolate shore. </20> <21 id="goatAppear7" who="Halvard"> We have nothing left and will soon give in to the wilderness... I beg of you, help us! </21> <22 id="goatAppear8" who="Rig"> We will lend you our aid. What would you have us do? </22> <23 id="goatAppear9" who="Halvard"> Thank you! It should not be too much trouble... </23> <24 id="goatAppear10" who="Halvard"> Your warriors need only exterminate the wolves threatening our fragile camp. </24> <25 id="lore1" who="Brand"> We've acquired enough Lore to develop a new skill. Please choose wisely, for it will have consequences for our expansion... and our survival. </25> <26 id="lore2" who="Brand"> It is crucial that we study any Runestone or Circle of Stones we encounter. It will allow our Loremasters to gather Lore and develop our Knowledge. </26> <27 id="wolfAttack1" who="Halvard"> Young lord! The beasts are upon us! We need assistance! Please send reinforcements at your earliest opportunity! </27> <28 id="endGoat1" who="Brand"> My lord, I am delighted to report that Halvard's camp is now safe from any beastly threat. </28> <29 id="endGoat2" who="Rig"> Excellent. Please make sure his people receive the food they need. And tend to their wounded. </29> <30 id="endGoat3" who="Halvard"> On behalf of the Heidrun Clan, I would like to express our most heartfelt gratitude. We would have been doomed without you. </30> <31 id="endGoat4" who="Halvard"> From now until the end of time, you can count on the help and loyalty of the Goat Clan. I hereby solemnly pledge my allegiance to you. </31> <32 id="endFame" who="Brand"> Glorious! Our Clan has reached a notable level of fame. Our influence over the region is strong, and our people's hearts are filled with pride! </32> <33 id="endTerritory" who="Brand"> Magnificent! Our territory has reached a substantial size. The populace will be able to thrive here after we leave for the next region. </33> <34 id="defeatGoat" who="Halvard"> Woe is us! You won't make it in time... We are doomed. Yet we go to the grave without resentment. May you succeed where we failed! </34>
Foothold.tutorial: <0 id="title"> The Clan of Eikthyrnir </0> <1 id="sentence1"> The Clan of the Stag enjoys extra resources as it develops and thrives. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> They also excel when it comes to [Happy] and [Fame], so take advantage of these assets to expand in peace. </2>

Outpost.name: Settlement
Outpost.desc: Hagen is reported to have settled in the region. We must strengthen our position while trying to find him.
Outpost.objectives: <0 id="mTemple"> Build a [Tavern] and an [Temple]. <1 id="mFame"> Reach ::value:: [Fame]. <2 id="mRaven"> Destroy the Raven Outpost. <3 id="bSheep"> Hold ::value:: [Sheep] in [Sheepfold]s at any one time. <4 id="bValkyrie"> Kill all [Valkyrie]s. <5 id="bFeast"> Organize ::value:: Feasts. <6 id="mWait"> Hold out until reinforcements arrive.
Outpost.cinematic: <0> The sons of Heidrun had been shipwrecked on an inhospitable coast, but we arrived just in time to save them from the fangs of the wolves. </0> <1> Halvard, their elderly leader, was so grateful he swore allegiance to me the moment we met. </1> <2> He readily agreed to share invaluable secrets about survival. Soon enough, we would be taming the wilderness. </2>
Outpost.texts: <0 id="start1" who="Rig"> Hagen is out there somewhere. We need to find him and kill him. </0> <1 id="start2" who="Brand"> My lord, I understand your eagerness, but we must settle in enough to establish control over the new regions. </1> <2 id="start3" who="Halvard"> This area would seem to suit our plans. We should absolutely settle here. Heidrun's followers are tough survivors, so allow us to lay the groundwork for your conquest of Northgard. </2> <3 id="start4" who="Brand"> Halvard is a reliable ally who is equally persistent and composed. </3> <4 id="start5" who="Brand"> Let him honor his debt and prove his allegiance to you. In the meantime, I will take my leave and attend to the business we discussed. </4> <5 id="start6" who="Rig"> Understood. Please travel safely, Brand. </5> <6 id="start6bye" who="Brand"> Fare thee well, my lord. I shall return soon. </6> <7 id="start7" who="Rig"> Halvard, you will assist me in this operation. </7> <8 id="start8" who="Halvard"> Thank you, young lord. I will not disappoint you. </8> <9 id="valkyrie1" who="Rig"> Lo! A Valkyrie. Methinks Odin's maids could help us defeat our enemies. </9> <10 id="valkyrie2" who="Halvard"> Wait, my lord. I am afraid something is wrong with these ones... </10> <11 id="valkyrie3" who="Rig"> Oh, indeed. What a tragedy. It seems these fair creatures have been tainted by some corrupt influence. </11> <12 id="valkyrie4" who="Halvard"> There is naught we can do but put them out of their misery. However, we should expect them to be formidable foes. </12> <13 id="kobold1" who="Rig"> What are those ugly little critters? </13> <14 id="kobold2" who="Halvard"> I believe those are kobolds. They were a rare sight back on the continent, but they seem to thrive here on Northgard. </14> <15 id="kobold3" who="Halvard"> They are not aggressive, but they do exhibit territorial behavior. They will most certainly attack if we trespass. </15> <16 id="kobold4" who="Rig"> Hmm, would they accept to trade with us, I wonder? </16> <17 id="raven1" who="Halvard"> Young lord! We have spotted men from another clan. I think you are going to relish this. </17> <18 id="raven2" who="Hagen"> What? The Goats survived? I thought they'd ended up in the wolves' bellies. Halvard, ya senile billy goat, ya really are tough meat! Surrender now and I'll spare ya. </18> <19 id="raven3" who="Rig"> No one is going to surrender, Hagen. Not even you will be given this chance. You killed my father. Prepare to die. </19> <20 id="raven4" who="Hagen"> The High King's son be here too? Oh my... Nuttin' quite went accordin' to plan. I thought I'd killed ya, but it matters no longer. I'll finish the job now. </20> <21 id="raven5" who="Halvard"> Overconfidence will only make it worse for you. You've accomplished but one thing: making more enemies than you already had. </21> <22 id="raven6" who="Rig"> Halvard, there's been a change of plan. Our objective now is to destroy his outpost. </22> <23 id="raven7" who="Rig"> That feathered bastard may be planning to harry us with mercenary raids. It might be wise to erect defense towers at the borders of our territory. </23> <24 id="raven8" who="Halvard"> Indeed. We should also improve our scout camp so that our scouts are able to perform reconnaissance in enemy territory. </24> <25 id="attack1" who="Hagen"> Ye never know when to quit, do ya? Well, can't say I didn't warn you lot. </25> <26 id="attack2" who="Hagen"> Mercenaries, your purses will be filled to the brim if ye defeat 'em! I won't be riskin' my life here. Fare thee well! </26> <27 id="attack3" who="Rig"> No! Stay here, you coward! </27> <28 id="attack4" who="Halvard"> Young lord, Hagen seems willing to go all out on this. I do not think we can hold them off for long. I am so sorry we failed you! </28> <29 id="attack5" who="Rig"> Do not lose hope, Halvard. Trust me when I say you'll live to see another day. </29> <30 id="wolf1" who="Brand"> I believe we arrived just in time. </30> <31 id="wolf2" who="Egil"> Just in time? We missed out on most of the bloodshed! </31> <32 id="wolf3" who="Rig"> Greetings, Egil of the Wolf Clan. I am Rig, son of High K- </32> <33 id="wolf4" who="Egil"> Right, good for you. There's still crows standing, so how's about we let our axes do the talking! </33> <34 id="end1" who="Halvard"> Thank the gods for your intervention. I am truly grateful you risked your lives to save us. </34> <35 id="end2" who="Egil"> Wait, what? You mean we came here to save people? </35> <36 id="end3" who="Brand"> Let me guess: you stopped listening at "slaughtering mercenaries"? </36> <37 id="end4" who="Halvard"> Not to sound ungrateful, but was that level of savagery really necessary? </37> <38 id="end5" who="Egil"> I'll be sure to give Hagen a hug from you right before I slay him. </38> <39 id="end6" who="Halvard"> So much hubris and recklessness within one man... I pray you live long enough to reap the fruit of your victories. </39> <40 id="endFame" who="Halvard"> Fabulous! We've managed to build up a decent reputation in the region, and our Fame is substantial. </40> <41 id="endAltar1" who="Rig"> We've done it! We built the Altar of Kings, one of the most magnificent monuments one could hope to erect! </41> <42 id="endAltar2" who="Halvard"> Not to mention the brewery. Our good people can now find relief after a hard day's labor. They are very grateful to you, young lord. </42> <43 id="endAltar3" who="Rig"> My people's happiness is a priority of mine. Surviving is one thing–living is something else entirely. </43>
Outpost.tutorial: <0 id="title"> The Clan of Heidrun <1 id="sentence1"> The Goat Clan benefits from [Sheep] farming, taking advantage of these animals by sheltering them in [Sheepfold]s (a building unique to them). <2 id="sentence2"> Having mastered the science of food preservation, they can afford to organize hearty Feasts that will boost their [Happy] and productivity.

Settling.name: Trade War
Settling.desc: This estuary is a critical chokepoint for trade. We must establish a trading network that will allow us to provide supplies to our future expeditions.
Settling.objectives: <0 id="mPort"> Build a [Port] and complete it with a [Lighthouse]. </0> <1 id="mPrestige"> Reach ::value:: [Prestige] with Great Trade Routes before the Raven Clan does. </1> <2 id="bSurrender"> Force the Raven Clan to surrender. </2> <3 id="bTrade"> Trade with all neutral factions at the same time over ::value:: month(s). </3> <4 id="bMerchant"> Have 12 [Merchant]s and 6 [Sailor]s active at any one time. </4>
Settling.cinematic: <0> Hagen had eluded us, so Egil left to track him down himself. He was to send for me upon finding him. </0> <1> In the meantime, Brand and Halvard insisted we establish a far-reaching supply network for all our future expeditions throughout Northgard. </1> <2> This would be a war of another kind entirely, one to be fought with gold rather than steel. </2> <3> I just had to focus on the task at hand, waiting to hear from Egil. </3>
Settling.texts: <0 id="start1" who="Rig"> Here we are. Certainly an excellent spot to establish a commercial chokepoint. </0> <1 id="start2" who="Halvard"> Let us roll up our sleeves. To be honest, I would rather not spill blood. 'Tis bad for business. </1> <2 id="start3" who="Liv"> Good day, my lords. I see we have all come to the same conclusion: this region should be the commercial nerve center for the victors. </2> <3 id="start4" who="Brand"> Greetings. You must be Liv of the Raven Clan, lieutenant to that scum Hagen. I would rather be your ally than your enemy, but the Norns seem to disagree. </3> <4 id="start5" who="Rig"> Do not expect mercy from me, Raven. Soon enough, all goods entering Northgard will have to go through us. </4> <5 id="start6" who="Liv"> Indeed, there is only room for one trade tycoon. And I'm afraid I cannot let you put a spoke in my wheel. Still, I wish you good luck. </5> <6 id="start7" who="Halvard"> Refreshing to see that battles can still be fought without childish chest-thumping. We too bid you good fortune, for you will need it! </6> <7 id="start8" who="Rig"> We had better get started. The key to victory is to build a longship dock and a lighthouse, then make use of great trade routes. </7> <8 id="upgrade1NoStoneGoat" who="Halvard"> Apologies, young lord, but should we not worry about gathering stone? Stone is instrumental in upgrading buildings. </8> <9 id="upgrade1NoStoneStag" who="Brand"> My lord, I just got word that we have no stone in our reserves. We should build a mine and gather some, as is it vital for building upgrades. </9> <10 id="upgrade2" who="Rig"> I admit it had slipped my mind. Yes, we should find a deposit and exploit it as soon as possible. Then upgrade our buildings, of course. </10> <11 id="upgrade1Stone" who="Rig"> Well, winter is behind us, and we have some stone in store... Now we should try to upgrade as many buildings as possible. </11> <12 id="upgrade3" who="DefaultBannerman"> Good thinking. Upgrading is more than just a luxury–it is key to victory. It will allow us to affect more workers and make our activities more efficient. </12> <13 id="upgrade4" who="DefaultBannerman"> We probably won't be able to upgrade all our structures, though. We should carefully determine which are most important. </13> <14 id="upgrade5" who="Rig"> And we should remember to keep mining iron, as well. Our workers could use better tools! </14> <15 id="giant1" who="Brand"> Giants, how wonderful! Northgard is just full of surprises. Rather intimidating ones at that. </15> <16 id="giant2" who="Halvard"> The Jötnar are said to be formidable opponents. They are peaceful but will take any intrusion as an aggressive action. I strongly advise against antagonizing them. </16> <17 id="giant3" who="Rig"> If they agree to trade with us, we could build a mutually beneficial relationship. It's worth trying. We should establish a route from a trading post. </17> <18 id="end1" who="Rig"> Our trade supremacy over the region is now established. Any resource that goes through this estuary will have to go through us. </18> <19 id="end2" who="Liv"> Congratulations, my lords. I have been bested, fair and square. </19> <20 id="end3" who="Liv"> I suspect my master will not take this kindly, however. So, do enjoy this hegemony of yours while it lasts. </20> <21 id="end4" who="Liv"> Well, this region has outlived its usefulness to me. I bid you farewell. </21> <22 id="end5" who="Liv"> I am less than eager to hear Hagen's reaction to this. No doubt I am in for an earful... </22> <23 id="end6" who="Halvard"> What an uncanny reaction. She had fought with fierceness and resolve, and yet her praise seemed sincere. </23> <24 id="end7" who="Rig"> Brand, Halvard, I've just heard from Egil. He has tracked Hagen down to a region nearby, and so I shall join him now. I would ask you to fortify what we've built here. </24> <25 id="end8" who="Brand"> I am glad your revenge is at last within your reach. Be safe, my lord. We will join you as soon as we can. </25> <26 id="end9" who="Halvard"> Do keep in mind: all our future operations can connect to this region by establishing a trade route from a trading post. </26> <27 id="defeat1" who="Liv"> It is done. Your control of the region is negligible. Oh, I will trade with you, but do not expect friendly prices! </27> <28 id="defeat2" who="Brand"> 'Tis a disaster, my lord! There is no way we can conquer Northgard after losing such a strategically vital chokepoint! </28> <29 id="defeat3" who="Halvard"> All that effort... for naught! </29> <30 id="ravenBuiltLighthouse1" who="DefaultBannerman"> I am loath to report this, but Liv has finished building her lighthouse. She is bound to launch major expeditions soon! </30> <31 id="ravenBuiltLighthouse2" who="Rig"> This means building a lighthouse of our own should be our top priority. We cannot afford to fall behind. </31> <32 id="ravenAheadStage1" who="DefaultBannerman"> Reports show that Liv has a good headstart. We should work twice as hard to keep from falling behind. </32> <33 id="ravenAheadStage2" who="DefaultBannerman"> Liv has taken the lead. We need to hurry and catch up with her! </33> <34 id="ravenWinning1Stag" who="Brand"> Curses! Liv is winning this war! Even if we put all our resources into the most prominent routes, we could not catch up with her. </34> <35 id="ravenWinning1Goat" who="Halvard"> Young lord, I abhor the thought, but I fear we are fighting a losing battle. According to my calculations, Liv is so far ahead we cannot possibly catch up with her. </35> <36 id="ravenWinning2" who="Rig"> I have reached the same conclusion. But there is still one way we can win this. </36> <37 id="ravenWinning3Stag" who="Brand"> Are you suggesting we harry her with our armed forces? </37> <38 id="ravenWinning3Goat" who="Halvard"> Surely you're not considering this... </38> <39 id="ravenWinning4" who="Rig"> I am. Attacking Liv now would force her to divert resources to defense. I do not suggest we try to defeat her militarily–we need only hinder her progress long enough to close the gap. </39> <40 id="ravenWinning5Stag" who="Brand"> She will most likely retaliate, but this is preferable to losing the region right away, which we are bound to do at this rate. Well thought out, my lord. </40> <41 id="ravenWinning5Goat" who="Halvard"> This may well be the only viable strategy we have left. Nevertheless, we should expect a swift retaliation. </41> <42 id="ravenAttacked1" who="Liv"> Using force, are you? Perhaps I expected too much finesse from brutes like you. Boys will be boys, I suppose. </42> <43 id="ravenAttacked2" who="Liv"> Well, you shall have to negotiate with my mercenaries. </43> <44 id="endDestroyRaven1" who="Rig"> Greetings, Liv. I'm afraid I must put an end to your business here. Steel beats gold. </44> <45 id="endDestroyRaven2" who="Liv"> I cannot say I expected this outcome. 'Twas all fun and games, yet I fear someone may lose an eye. That's it, then. I humbly surrender. </45> <46 id="endDestroyRaven3Goat" who="Halvard"> This is most awkward. To be honest, I didn't condone this military assault, but Lord Rig insisted on putting the war back in "trade war." </46> <47 id="endDestroyRaven3Stag" who="Brand"> I do not entirely subscribe to this definition of victory, but Lord Rig appears to believe that a trade war is still a war. </47> <48 id="endDestroyRaven4" who="Liv"> Means to an end, perhaps. I can appreciate that. Well played, my lords. </48> <49 id="endIsNigh1" who="DefaultBannerman"> My lord, our business is doing quite well... I think we will soon reach our ultimate goal. </49> <50 id="endIsNigh2" who="Rig"> You may be right, but we shouldn't rest on our laurels. </50>
Settling.tutorial: <0 id="title"> Trade Victory </0> <1 id="sentence1"> The goal here is not to crush your foe by sheer force. Make contact with other clans, and train [Sailor]s and [Merchant]s to establish trade routes with them. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> You must build a [Port], then add a [Lighthouse] to it, if you want to increase your influence and establish Great Trade Routes. </2>

Skirmish.name: Punitive Expedition
Skirmish.desc: Egil has finally found Hagen. I am joining him to launch a punitive party. We must strike fast.
Skirmish.objectives: <0 id="mHagen"> Find and kill Hagen before he gets reinforcements. </0> <1 id="bOutpost"> Destroy both secondary Raven Outposts. </1> <2 id="bYear"> Kill Hagen before Year ::value::. </2> <3 id="bBerserker"> Complete the mission without Egil being defeated. </3>
Skirmish.cinematic: <0> Egil was a fierce, ruthless man. His relentlessness on the battlefield often made his enemies believe he paid no mind to tactics. </0> <1> Granted, he never planned very far ahead, but he made up for it by adapting to any situation, no matter how complicated. </1> <2> It was a good thing too, because our "plan" was to raid a Raven settlement from the sea, claim it, then launch a punitive expedition against Hagen from there. </2>
Skirmish.texts: <0 id="start0" who="Rig"> Land ho! Draw your axes and brace yourselves! </0> <1 id="start1" who="Egil"> All right, boys, it's plundering time! CHAAAARGE! </1> <2 id="start2" who="Rig"> There–this area is now under our control. </2> <3 id="start3" who="Rig"> Warriors, we are here to ferret out that scum Hagen and slay him. I shall have my revenge! </3> <4 id="start4" who="Egil"> As much as I love a good brawl, we should probably maintain the element of surprise until the decisive strike. </4> <5 id="start5" who="Egil"> We'll claim their buildings, but making more is out of the question. Wars are won by leveling cities, not building them! </5> <6 id="start6" who="Rig"> Well, I see your point, but... </6> <7 id="start7" who="Rig"> Should we not at least ask the villagers to repair those buildings before they burn out entirely? </7> <8 id="start8" who="Egil"> I guess it wouldn't hurt. As long as I'm not the one doing the fixing. I'm better at wrecking stuff, anyway. </8> <9 id="start9" who="Egil"> Plus, I've got the munchies. Let's go find some grub where it is: in the wild. Wolves are tasty–if they don't eat you first. </9> <10 id="renfort" who="Rig"> We must strike fast. Dawdling will only allow Hagen to regroup his forces. </10> <11 id="renfortDebarquement" who="Egil"> Darn! They've got reinforcements. Well, too late for finesse. CHARGE! </11> <12 id="sheep1" who="Rig"> We should colonize this area. There are some sheep there. We could slaughter them for food and get a nice boost from it. </12> <13 id="olafDiscovered" who="Egil"> This outpost isn't worth it. My axes are itching to strike, but it's probably better to stay clear of it and remain unnoticed for now. </13> <14 id="einarDiscovered" who="Rig"> Hagen is not here. We should maintain the element of surprise for as long as we can. </14> <15 id="hagenDiscovered1" who="Rig"> At last, we're closing in on Hagen's settlement. </15> <16 id="hagenDiscovered2" who="Rig"> Let us hit him again and again! He will join his ancestors in Helheim! </16> <17 id="outpostOlaf" who="Rig"> And one outpost down! Hagen, we are coming for you! </17> <18 id="outpostEinar" who="Egil"> I'm unstoppable! Wish I could see Hagen's face right now. </18> <19 id="end1" who="Egil"> Well, well, well... We meet again, crow. Told you I wouldn't let it go. </19> <20 id="end2" who="Hagen"> Like the obedient hound y'are. Let me talk to yer master–I've a proposition to make. </20> <21 id="end3" who="Rig"> I am here, Hagen. Nothing you say can possibly stop me from avenging my father. </21> <22 id="end4" who="Liv"> Ah, it looks like I arrived just in time. </22> <23 id="end5" who="Hagen"> Liv, my dear apprentice! Help me! Kill these men! </23> <24 id="end6" who="Liv"> Not going to happen, Hagen. You've been bested, and I won't be on the losing side if I can help it. At least show some dignity. </24> <25 id="end7" who="Hagen"> Liv, you despicable traitoress! You owe me everything! I made ya what you are! </25> <26 id="end8" who="Liv"> You're wrong. I did. You were but a stepping stone. </26> <27 id="end9" who="Hagen"> C... curse you... Liv... </27> <28 id="end10" who="Egil"> Wow! That was cold, even by my standards. </28> <29 id="end11" who="Rig"> You just took away my sole opportunity to avenge my father! Egil, end her. </29> <30 id="end12" who="Egil"> With pleasure. </30> <31 id="end13" who="Liv"> Wait! </31> <32 id="end14" who="Liv"> I knew you would be upset, my lord, but hear me out! Hagen was a pathetic fool, but he was not the real menace. </32> <33 id="end15" who="Rig"> Go on... </33> <34 id="end16" who="Liv"> Let me pledge my allegiance to you, and I will reveal your true enemy. There is much I have to tell you... </34> <35 id="hurryup1" who="Rig"> Egil, I'm beginning to worry about your strategy. We are running out of food, and Hagen will have reinforcements before long. </35> <36 id="hurryup2" who="Egil"> Yeah, I hadn't planned this far. Let's hurry up and drive Hagen out now! </36> <37 id="hagenWorried1" who="Hagen"> Hmm... been a while since I heard from the outpost up north. I don't like it one bit... </37> <38 id="hagenWorried2" who="Hagen"> Liv, make yerself useful for once! Put together a party of mercenaries to check it out. </38> <39 id="hagenWorried3" who="Liv"> ... </39> <40 id="hagenWorried4" who="Hagen"> Ya deaf, runt? Get a move on! </40> <41 id="hagenWorried5" who="Liv"> Very well, master... </41>
Skirmish.tutorial: <0 id="title"> The Clan of Fenrir </0> <1 id="sentence1"> The Wolf Clan lives off warfare and hunting. Salvage [Meat] directly from the [Wolf]s and [Bear]s you slay in the wild. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> Don't hesitate to be belligerent. Aggression is the clan's primary lifestyle–they even draw [Happy] from their military power! </2>

Act1Ending.name: Liv's Revelations
Act1Ending.desc: Hagen is dead, but Liv's revelations have unveiled a greater threat and given us a new goal.
Act1Ending.cinematic: <0> Liv had taken us all by surprise! Despite our eventful history, I decided to give her a chance to redeem herself. </0> <1> She told us that Hagen was but a pawn, a mercenary hired by a man known as Hvedrung. He was the leader of the Boar Clan, which was native to Northgard. </1> <2> The mystery behind my tragedy grew, but one thing became clear: this "Hvedrung" was the mind commanding the hand... my father's true murderer. </2>

Rescue.name: Intervention
Rescue.desc: The rebel faction of the Boar Clan faces extinction on a small island. Liv will help us repel the loyalists and save the rebel leader.
Rescue.objectives: <0 id="mMercenary"> Reach ::value:: [Fame] to unlock Mercenaries. </0> <1 id="mHvedrung"> Destroy the Boar loyalists' [TownHall]. </1> <2 id="bRequest"> Fulfill every one of Svarn's requests. </2> <3 id="bFame"> Reach ::value:: [Fame] before Year 4. </3> <4 id="bPort"> Win without building a [RavenPort]. </4> <5 id="mRequestFood"> Give ::value:: [Food] to Svarn before Give [Food] </5> <6 id="mRequestWood"> Give ::value:: [Wood] to Svarn before Give [Wood] </6> <7 id="mRequestMoney"> Give ::value:: [Money] to Svarn before Give [Money] </7> <8 id="mRequests"> Do not fail to meet Svarn's requests more than twice. </8>
Rescue.cinematic: <0> Thanks to Liv, we learned that a small faction had split from the Boar Clan and that Hvedrung was trying to crush this uprising. </0> <1> If anyone could reveal Hvedrung's plans and weaknesses, it was the rebels' leader. I had to meet him. </1> <2> But first, we had to save our potential new ally, besieged by the loyalists. Liv would put her mercenary raids to good use. In a stroke of irony, our former enemy would save our future friend... </2>
Rescue.texts: <0 id="start1" who="Rig"> This vendetta is none of our business, but if we join forces with the rebels, we may manage to defeat Hvedrung. </0> <1 id="start2" who="Liv"> I will assist you in this mission, my lord. I am nothing like Hagen, and I shall prove it to you. </1> <2 id="start3" who="Svarn"> Freyja has finally answered our plea. I have... foreseen your coming. </2> <3 id="start4" who="Svarn"> I... dreamt of a raven... swooping down on Hvedrung's face... pecking his eyes out. </3> <4 id="start5" who="???"> Svarn, your defiance is pointless. I have the horn now. </4> <5 id="start6" who="Hvedrung"> I will quell your uprising, with or without their intervention. I too have foreseen the raven's coming, but in my dream, I crushed it in my fist. </5> <6 id="start7" who="Rig"> So, we finally meet, Hvedrung. I think you underestimate the toughness of this particular raven. It is two versus one now: your reign of terror is over. </6> <7 id="start8" who="Hvedrung"> Reign of terror? Is that what you think this is? You have every reason to hate me, and I shall not deny my responsibility for your tragedy. </7> <8 id="start9" who="Hvedrung"> Call me a villain if you like. Give in to rage if it numbs your pain. </8> <9 id="start10" who="Hvedrung"> But this horn of yours has a higher purpose–one your simple mind could not fathom. One day you might understand. In a way, I do all of this for you. </9> <10 id="start11" who="Rig"> I... what? Do not try to present yourself in a favorable light, scum! </10> <11 id="start12" who="Hvedrung"> Much is left to do. I shall take my leave now. I bid you farewell. </11> <12 id="start13" who="Rig"> NO! Come back here, you cowardly swine! Come and fight! </12> <13 id="start14" who="Hvedrung"> My boy, I am not running away. I promise we will meet again and you shall have your revenge. When this day comes, I shall not duck away from it. Until then... </13> <14 id="start15" who="Hvedrung"> Soldiers, I want Svarn's head. Put an end to this futile rebellion. </14> <15 id="start16" who="Rig"> I want that man DEAD! Liv, for now, our priority is to aid Svarn. Do not disappoint me. </15> <16 id="start17" who="Liv"> I am not worried in the least. My clan is well-versed in attacks from the sea. This island's terrain will give me an edge, and the enemy has their back to the water. </16> <17 id="harbor1" who="Liv"> My clan is master of the seas as well as trade. It is crucial that we build a harbor. </17> <18 id="fame1" who="Liv"> We now have enough fame to recruit mercenaries. Now we can harry the loyalists' shores! </18> <19 id="ask1" who="Svarn"> We are starving... Winter might be our last... ordeal at this rate. </19> <20 id="ask2" who="Svarn"> Please, spare some food. We shall be... grateful. </20> <21 id="ask3" who="Liv"> Hmm, winter looms ahead, indeed. A drain on my pantry will not make my job any easier. </21> <22 id="ask4" who="Liv"> Moreover, I'm fairly certain this will not be the last of their requests. </22> <23 id="ask5" who="Rig"> I understand this is quite a sacrifice, Liv, but if they starve to death, there will be no one left to rescue. </23> <24 id="ask6" who="Liv"> Fair enough. </24> <25 id="defeatBoar1" who="Svarn"> I cannot... resist their attacks any longer... All is lost... </25> <26 id="defeatBoar2" who="Rig"> I am sorry we failed you, Svarn. May you join Freyja in Fólkvang... </26> <27 id="end1" who="Liv"> Finally! Those tough bastards have yielded. </27> <28 id="end2" who="Svarn"> My... deepest thanks. We have lost many a good man, but they all... knew the risks they faced in... defying Hvedrung. </28> <29 id="end3" who="Svarn"> I take no... joy in seeing his men die, though, for they too were once our brethren. </29> <30 id="end4" who="Rig"> I can only imagine how painful a civil war must be. Svarn, your brothers have not died in vain. Join me, and together we shall put an end to Hvedrung's plans. </30> <31 id="end5" who="Svarn"> We will... gladly join your cause. There is much you have to... know about Hvedrung, and there might be yet more I need to learn... </31> <32 id="requestFailA1" who="Rig"> Svarn, we tried our best, but we cannot afford to spare supplies this time. </32> <33 id="requestFailA2" who="Svarn"> I... do not doubt your good will. Thank you for trying... Worry not, for we can still resist on our own. </33> <34 id="requestFailB1" who="Rig"> Svarn... Once again, we are unable to provide supplies. Will you be able to hold on? </34> <35 id="requestFailB2" who="Svarn"> Our situation is getting... grimmer by the day. To be frank, we are hanging by a thread. </35> <36 id="requestFailB3" who="Rig"> Liv, did you hear? I do not think there will be a third time. If we let Svarn down once more, he is done for! </36> <37 id="requestFailB4" who="Liv"> Yes, I heard. I am trying my best here. </37> <38 id="requestFailB5" who="Rig"> I know, Liv, I know. </38> <39 id="firstTowerDown1" who="Svarn"> We are... losing ground... </39> <40 id="firstTowerDown2" who="Liv"> Will you be able to hold out? </40> <41 id="firstTowerDown3" who="Svarn"> I... think so... Two towers still stand. We should be able to fend them off... for how long, I do not know. </41> <42 id="secondTowerDown1" who="Svarn"> Our... second tower is down... </42> <43 id="secondTowerDown2" who="Liv"> Hmm, things are starting to look grim. </43> <44 id="secondTowerDown3" who="Rig"> What can we do, apart from matching his requests? </44> <45 id="secondTowerDown4" who="Liv"> I am not sure... Maybe we should try to distract Hvedrung's forces? </45> <46 id="secondTowerDown5" who="Rig"> You're probably right. At any rate, Svarn will not be able to hold out for long. If they lose their last tower, they are done for. </46>
Rescue.tutorial: <0 id="title"> The Clan of Huginn and Muninn </0> <1 id="sentence1"> The Raven Clan can use their deep pockets filled with [Money]s to colonize new areas. They are the masters of trade and seldom lack riches. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> Their main asset is the ability to launch [Mercenary] Raids to harry their foes from the sea, while keeping out of reach from retaliation. </2>

Giants.name: Jötunnheim
Giants.desc: We have to cross Jötunnheim, the land of giants, on our journey to the Runestone of Asgard. The Jötnar are a peaceful people. What could go wrong?
Giants.objectives: <0 id="mWar"> Destroy the enemy faction so your army can traverse the region. </0> <1 id="mHeroGiant"> Keep your Jötunn Champion alive at all costs. </1> <2 id="mSword"> Find a peaceful resolution to the conflict by revealing the Jötnar's ancient lore. </2> <3 id="bTrade"> Supply [Food] to your [Giant] allies through trade until they let you through. </3> <4 id="bSword"> Unravel the Jötnar's forgotten history by studying the giant sword. </4> <5 id="bMender"> Win without having a [Mender]. </5> <6 id="mTrade"> Supply [Food] to your [Giant] allies through trade until they let you through. </6>
Giants.cinematic: <0> With a serene face betraying no inner turmoil, Svarn, the rebel Boar leader, detailed Hvedrung's plan, although I could feel something boiling deep within him. </0> <1> The tyrant intended to destroy Bifrost, the legendary bridge to Asgard, for reasons unknown. But this would bring about Ragnarök, the end of the gods... and of our time. Svarn's rebellion existed solely to prevent this. </1> <2> Bifrost lay hidden, somewhere deep within Northgard. Svarn hoped to learn more by deciphering the gigantic Runestone of Asgard, an ancient frieze said to have been engraved by Odin himself. </2> <3> It was the beginning of a very long journey. And the first step was to cross a region called Jötunnheim: the land of giants. </3>
Giants.texts: <0 id="start1" who="Rig"> So, this is Jötunnheim. We have come across Jötnar in the past, so I am not too worried about crossing their homeland. </0> <1 id="start2" who="Skrymir"> No, Fjolsvin, it is OBVIOUS that all the sheep's wool and meat are rightfully ours. We own the animals and the grass they graze, so it is only fair we benefit from what they produce. </1> <2 id="start3" who="Skrymir"> You should be thankful: not only do we reward you for your measly labor, but we also defend you and the sheep from any danger! </2> <3 id="start4" who="Fjolsvin"> Reward?! My men are practically starving! You just sit all day, feasting off our "measly" labor! </3> <4 id="start5" who="Fjolsvin"> WE tend to the sheep, WE feed and clothe you, so WE should get to enjoy all of their products! </4> <5 id="start6" who="Rig"> Greetings, Jötnar. I am Rig, son of the late High King Hargurorf. We come in peace–we only ask that you let us pass, for we have vital business beyond the Jötunnheimar. </5> <6 id="start7" who="Skrymir"> SILENCE, HUMAN! I know nothing of you, nor do I care to. </6> <7 id="start8" who="Fjolsvin"> Wait, Skrymir, I have an idea. Why not ask the human who is in the right? This dispute has gone on long enough! </7> <8 id="start9" who="Rig"> I would rather not take sides. We just want through, really. </8> <9 id="start10" who="Skrymir"> We shall let you through once you pick a side. </9> <10 id="start11" who="Brand"> To me it is evident the owner of the sheep and the land should reap the benefits. It is theirs by right, without question. </10> <11 id="start12" who="Svarn"> Those... are the words of a... spoiled child. Property is just one more way to... oppress the workers. </11> <12 id="start13" who="Liv"> I suggest they share both the work and the benefits. We simply have to establish a list of tasks and deadlines, and then divide the products equitably, notwithstanding the– </12> <13 id="start14" who="Egil"> Simpler solution: we cut all the sheep in half and split them fifty-fifty. </13> <14 id="start15" who="Halvard"> I think the sheep's free will should also be taken into account. Perhaps THEY should choose where their products go. </14> <15 id="start16" who="Rig"> Wait, everyone! I must consider this. </15> <16 id="start17" who="Fjolsvin"> Should the wool and meat come down to us, we who work hard and protect and care for the sheep? </16> <17 id="start18" who="Skrymir"> ...Or to us, the rightful owners of the sheep and the land, which we inherited from our ancestors? </17> <18 id="start19" who="Fjolsvin"> And no, we won't share any longer. That would be betraying our forefathers' efforts. </18> <19 id="start20" who="Skrymir"> So... which will it be? </19> <20 id="playerChoiceTeamA" who="Rig"> I think Skrymir has a point. They own the sheep and the land, and they do reward and protect their workforce. Fjolsvin and his men are biting the hand that feeds them! </20> <21 id="playerChoiceTeamB" who="Rig"> I believe Fjolsvin is right: they may not OWN anything, but their hard work should entitle them to most of the benefits. Skrymir can make do with a fraction of the food. </21> <22 id="playerChoiceNoTeam" who="Rig"> If you cannot work together and share both the labor and the benefits, then you are both of you fools. Again, I just want through, and I WILL have it my way. </22> <23 id="beginTeamA1" who="Fjolsvin"> So you join the decadent oppressors! Brace for the righteous wrath of hard-working folk! </23> <24 id="beginTeamA2" who="Skrymir"> That peasant Fjolsvin is responding with violence, what a surprise. Rid me of the ungrateful vermin. </24> <25 id="beginTeamA3" who="Skrymir"> You can count on Lög, our Judicator, along with plenty of resources. </25> <26 id="beginTeamA4" who="Skrymir"> Should our Champion fall, we won't stand a chance. Lög must be kept alive at all costs! </26> <27 id="beginTeamB1" who="Skrymir"> So the humans join the ungrateful peasants! Brace for the wrath of the rightful lords of this region! </27> <28 id="beginTeamB2" who="Fjolsvin"> That scum Skrymir responds with violence, as usual.
