We must overthrow his reign and build a brighter future. </28> <29 id="beginTeamB3" who="Fjolsvin"> You can count on Jafnadr, Champion of the people, and a good amount of resources. </29> <30 id="beginTeamB4" who="Fjolsvin"> Should our Champion fall, we won't stand a chance. Jafnadr must be kept alive at all costs! </30> <31 id="sword1" who="Svarn"> This looks... interesting. The giant sword... this... relic of the Jötnar could tell us more about their... history... </31> <32 id="sword2" who="Rig"> Understood. Let us colonize the area and have our loremasters study it. </32> <33 id="swordColonized1" who="Rig"> Now, to study the old artifact... </33> <34 id="heroGiantDefeatTeamA1" who="Svarn"> My lord... the giant Lög... Judicator of the land, has... fallen on the battlefield! </34> <35 id="heroGiantDefeatTeamA2" who="Fjolsvin"> Lög has yielded, at last! You do not stand a chance. Surrender, humans! </35> <36 id="heroGiantDefeatTeamB1" who="Svarn"> My lord... the giant Jafnadr... Champion of the people, has... fallen on the battlefield! </36> <37 id="heroGiantDefeatTeamB2" who="Skrymir"> Jafnadr has yielded, at last! You do not stand a chance. Surrender, humans! </37> <38 id="endSword1" who="Svarn"> This is most... interesting... </38> <39 id="endSword1b" who="Svarn"> And this, back here? Could it be...? </39> <40 id="endSword1c" who="Svarn"> Yes, yes... It all makes sense now... This is... the most exciting discovery! </40> <41 id="endSword2" who="Svarn"> This is... or at least seems to be the sword of Bergelmir, one of only two survivors of the first generation of giants, and... ancestor to all living Jötnar. </41> <42 id="endSword3" who="Skrymir"> Yes, the sword represents the might of the rulers over the people. We protect them, and they work the land for us. The sword was placed here to split the population in two: the rulers and the peasants. </42> <43 id="endSword4" who="Fjolsvin"> We hate this relic. It represents oppression and division. It is a symbol of profound injustice. Bergelmir was most likely a tyrant. </43> <44 id="endSword5" who="Svarn"> Well... obviously none of you bothered to... study the relic. Bergelmir placed his sword here to... resolve a dispute between his sons. </44> <45 id="endSword6" who="Svarn"> The firstborn's birthright entitled him to Bergelmir's legacy, and the younger brother hated him for it. </45> <46 id="endSword7" who="Svarn"> Bergelmir divided the land in two–the land you now call Jötunnheim. The sword was never intended as a symbol of division, but rather of sharing: the land... pain... joys. He wanted his sons to live AND work together. </46> <47 id="endSword8" who="Skrymir"> Perhaps I have been selfish. To be quite honest, I do feel guilty for not working all day. I hide behind the law, but in truth, I feel like an imposter. </47> <48 id="endSword9" who="Fjolsvin"> And you do protect and feed us. Maybe there is a world in which we can share the work and its fruits, as Bergelmir's sons eventually did? </48> <49 id="endSword10" who="Skrymir"> Thank you for showing us the truth, human. It was right in front of us all along, being in the middle of the land. You may pass now. We will make peace and work together. </49> <50 id="endSword11" who="Rig"> You made all that up, did you not? </50> <51 id="endSword12" who="Svarn"> What do you think? It is just a big stone sword... with nothing written on it. Yet this small LIE shall beget a TRUTH of its own: a new world in which brothers are... united. </51> <52 id="endSword13" who="Rig"> What an uncomfortable piece of wisdom. Well, now we can resume our journey to the Runestone of Asgard. Well done, Svarn. </52> <53 id="endFightTeamA1" who="Rig"> There, Fjolsvin's rebellion has been crushed. I hope you are satisfied now, knowing you shall have to tend to the sheep and work the land yourselves. </53> <54 id="endFightTeamA2" who="Skrymir"> I, uhh... I confess I hadn't considered that. Ah, how hard can all that be, anyway? You may pass now–thank you for your help. You did the right thing. </54> <55 id="endFightTeamA3" who="Svarn"> I am not... sure about this... </55> <56 id="endFightTeamB1" who="Rig"> There, Skrymir and his lords have been overthrown. I hope you are happy–you will have to defend yourselves now. </56> <57 id="endFightTeamB2" who="Fjolsvin"> Well, how hard can that be? Besides, it is better than being despoiled by lazy rulers. </57> <58 id="endFightTeamB3" who="Svarn"> As the leader of a rebellion myself, I would find it hard to... disagree with you. Take care. </58> <59 id="endFight4" who="Rig"> I can't help thinking there could have been a less bloody alternative. </59> <60 id="endFightTeamA5" who="Skrymir"> You may be right, human. But it matters no longer. We bid you farewell now. </60> <61 id="endFightTeamB5" who="Fjolsvin"> You may be right, human. But it matters no longer. We bid you farewell now. </61> <62 id="endFightTeamA6" who="Rig"> Fare thee well, Skrymir. </62> <63 id="endFightTeamB6" who="Rig"> Fare thee well, Fjolsvin. </63> <64 id="endFight6" who="Rig"> Let us resume our journey to the Runestone of Asgard now, shall we? </64> <65 id="endCopainTeamA1" who="Skrymir"> We've enough supplies to crush this uprising ourselves. Thank you for your support, humans. You were on the side of justice. Never doubt that. </65> <66 id="endCopainTeamA2" who="Rig"> I still believe you could have worked this out peacefully with Fjolsvin, Skrymir. Will you let us through now? </66> <67 id="endCopainTeamA3" who="Skrymir"> We Jötnar are always true to our word. You may pass. Fare thee well. </67> <68 id="endCopainTeamB1" who="Fjolsvin"> We have enough supplies to overthrow their reign ourselves. Thank you for your support, humans. You were on the side of justice. Never doubt that. </68> <69 id="endCopainTeamB2" who="Rig"> I still believe you could have worked this out peacefully with Fjolsvin, Skrymir. Will you let us through now? </69> <70 id="endCopainTeamB3" who="Fjolsvin"> We Jötnar are always true to our word. You may pass. Fare thee well. </70> <71 id="endSwordIsNear1" who="Svarn"> My loremasters inform me they have made... great strides in understanding the secrets behind the giant relic. </71> <72 id="endSwordIsNear2" who="Rig"> Excellent. I wonder what this will teach us. </72> <73 id="startTradeGiant1TeamA" who="Skrymir"> Human, I couldn't help but notice you've been trading lots of food with us lately. </73> <74 id="startTradeGiant1TeamB" who="Fjolsvin"> Human, I couldn't help but notice you've been trading lots of food with us lately. </74> <75 id="startTradeGiant2" who="Rig"> Indeed... Is this a bad thing? </75> <76 id="startTradeGiant3TeamA" who="Skrymir"> On the contrary. It gave me an idea. If you can supply more–much more, in fact–we should be able to fight Fjolsvin's forces on our own. </76> <77 id="startTradeGiant3TeamB" who="Fjolsvin"> On the contrary. It gave me an idea. If you can supply more–much more, in fact–we should be able to fight Skrymir's forces on our own. </77> <78 id="startTradeGiant4" who="Rig"> So, if we manage to provide enough food, you will let us through? </78> <79 id="startTradeGiant5TeamA" who="Skrymir"> Yes. You will not regret it, for we are by no means short on riches. </79> <80 id="startTradeGiant5TeamB" who="Fjolsvin"> Yes. You will not regret it, for we are by no means short on riches. </80> <81 id="tradeAlmostFinished1" who="Rig"> We have traded ridiculous amounts of food with the Jötnar... We've nearly met our end of the bargain. </81> <82 id="tradeAlmostFinished2" who="Svarn"> Let us hope they will... keep theirs. </82>
Giants.tutorial: <0 id="title"> The Clan of Slidrugtanni </0> <1 id="sentence1"> The Boar Clan is a wild people able to exploit the bounties of nature, but having less proficiency in trade and construction. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> They are also supremely erudite, so take advantage of their Menders to expand your [Lore] quickly. </2>

Trials.name: Contest
Trials.desc: We are the first mainlanders to set foot in these regions. We will probably have to make our way through hostile wilds.
Trials.objectives: <0 id="mFame"> Win the contest by reaching ::value:: [Fame] before Borgild does. </0> <1 id="bWyvern"> Kill all the [Wyvern]s. </1> <2 id="bGiants"> Colonize the [Giant]s's camp. </2> <3 id="bBorgild"> Subdue Borgild by force. </3>
Trials.cinematic: <0> As we marched deeper into Northgard, Svarn wondered if the Regal Horn, the symbol of my royalty, could really be Gjallarhorn, Heimdall's famed instrument, said to herald Ragnarök. </0> <1> It would make sense; Hvedrung had killed my father and stolen my heirloom to end the world. My arch-nemesis gave me all the reasons in the world to hate him. </1> <2> Northgard had already thrown a great many trials at us since we first set foot here. </2> <3> But the one we would encounter next was not of these lands... </3>
Trials.texts: <0 id="start0A" who="Rig"> I must say, I am proud we are the first people from the mainland to venture this far into Northgard. </0> <1 id="start0B" who="DefaultBannerman"> Actually... it would seem someone beat us to it... </1> <2 id="start1" who="Borgild"> Greetings an' salutations! I'm Borgild of Bjarki, Clan of the Bear! </2> <3 id="start2" who="Rig"> Uhh... greetings? I am– </3> <4 id="start3" who="Borgild"> You are me new servants, and you can start working the fields right now. </4> <5 id="start4Stag" who="Brand"> Insolent woman! Do you not know who this man is? </5> <6 id="start4Goat" who="Halvard"> Apologies, milady, but do you realize to whom you are speaking? </6> <7 id="start4Wolf" who="Egil"> Uhh... don't you know this guy? </7> <8 id="start4Raven" who="Liv"> ...Are you aware of whom you stand before? </8> <9 id="start4Boar" who="Svarn"> Evidently... you are not... familiar with your interlocutor. </9> <10 id="start5" who="Borgild"> Oh, o' course I know him. He's Rig, son of the late High King Hargurorf. Do ye think me a peasant? </10> <11 id="start6Stag" who="Brand"> Then you are aware he is your king and that– </11> <12 id="start6Goat" who="Halvard"> Oh, good. Then you very well know he is king and– </12> <13 id="start6Wolf" who="Egil"> Okay, you're no peasant. But this guy is our king, so... </13> <14 id="start6Raven" who="Liv"> I would not dare call you this. But then, you are well aware he is king, and you are, ipso facto, his vassal. </14> <15 id="start6Boar" who="Svarn"> If you... know his lineage, you must understand... he is your king. </15> <16 id="start7" who="Borgild"> King? What king? I see no Regal Horn. No Regal Horn, no high king. We both be from the mainland, both here to conquer Northgard. For all I know, I could be heir to the throne! </16> <17 id="start8Stag" who="Brand"> You cannot be serious... </17> <18 id="start8Goat" who="Halvard"> Please do not go down this road... </18> <19 id="start8Wolf" who="Egil"> Ooh, I like her style! </19> <20 id="start8Raven" who="Liv"> As a female leader, I salute your ambition... but this is nonsense! </20> <21 id="start8Boar" who="Svarn"> This... is quite unexpected. You have... gumption, she-bear! Nevertheless, you... cannot pretend to the throne... </21> <22 id="start9Stag" who="Rig"> Brand, please. She is right, unfortunately. Without the horn, I am not officially high king. </22> <23 id="start9Goat" who="Rig"> Halvard, I share your concerns. But as a leader, I cannot shy away from this trial. </23> <24 id="start9Wolf" who="Rig"> By Hel, she has guts, I give you that. </24> <25 id="start9Raven" who="Rig"> Liv, she has a point. I am not my father–and alas, I no longer have the horn, so technically I cannot prove my birthright. </25> <26 id="start9Boar" who="Rig"> Svarn, I am afraid she may be right–I am not officially the high king. Perhaps it is my fate to prove it. </26> <27 id="start10" who="Rig"> Borgild, what would it take for you to accept me as your rightful sovereign? </27> <28 id="start11" who="Borgild"> Well... I say we engage in a contest. The clan that accomplishes the most epic deeds will be deemed victor and crowned high king. Well, high queen, most likely. </28> <29 id="start12" who="Borgild"> The loser, on the other hand... must bend the knee and satisfy the winner's every whim. </29> <30 id="start13Stag" who="Brand"> Epic deeds? When it comes to fame, you are on shaky ground with me! Lord Rig, let us put her to shame! </30> <31 id="start13Goat" who="Halvard"> That is ludicrous and unreasonable. Surely Lord Rig will not stoop to– </31> <32 id="start13Wolf" who="Egil"> Ooh, say yes! Say yes! </32> <33 id="start13Raven" who="Liv"> Fighting over fame is both childish and futile. Lord Rig will never– </33> <34 id="start13Boar" who="Svarn"> Pursuing fame is without merit... I do not... believe Lord Rig will– </34> <35 id="start14Stag" who="Rig"> Agreed. I accept the challenge, Borgild. </35> <36 id="start14Wolf" who="Rig"> What do you think? Of course I accept the challenge! </36> <37 id="start14Default" who="Rig"> I accept the challenge. </37> <38 id="start15Stag" who="Brand"> Excellent! I must admit, I was initially against this idea... but now I say make her pay for her hubris! </38> <39 id="start15GoatA" who="Halvard"> There, I knew the young lord would do the sensible thing. </39> <40 id="start15GoatB" who="Halvard"> Wait, what? Young lord, I beg you to reconsider. You've nothing to prove–you are the legitimate ruler of the clans! </40> <41 id="start15Wolf" who="Egil"> YAAAH! Fame means killing deadly things! I can't wait! </41> <42 id="start15Raven" who="Liv"> I cannot wait to waste resources just for show. Yay! </42> <43 id="start15Boar" who="Svarn"> Hmm... This is... interesting. I did not... foresee this outcome. </43> <44 id="start16Stag" who="Rig"> I am glad to hear this. Your resources and skalds will be put to good use. May this contest go down in history! </44> <45 id="start16Goat" who="Rig"> You may be right, Halvard, but I see no way around this trial. She will not let us through, and we cannot afford to antagonize her. </45> <46 id="start16Wolf" who="Rig"> Your strength and bravery will be precious assets, Egil. Let us show her how her might pales in comparison to ours! </46> <47 id="start16Raven" who="Rig"> Sarcasm noted. But my mind is made up. I will need all your wits for this. We WILL force Borgild into submission! </47> <48 id="start16Boar" who="Rig"> I understand you do not approve of my choice, but believe me, there much to be learned from this. We will emerge victorious. </48> <49 id="start17" who="Borgild"> Ha! Ye've got more nerve than I anticipated. 'Twill be interesting, for sure. Good luck to ya, hornless king! You'll be needin' it. </49> <50 id="winter1" who="Borgild"> Is it me or is it gettin' cold? Oh yes, winter is comin'! I guess you be planning on spending the cold season by the hearth, eatin' hot soup... </50> <51 id="winter2" who="Borgild"> But we won't. My clan THRIVES in winter. We won't be idlin' around, and neither should ye. </51> <52 id="winter3" who="Rig"> This will not make our task any easier. She is right–we can't afford to hibernate, or we will fall behind. </52> <53 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern1" who="Rig"> A wyvern! My father used to boast of fighting one during his travels, but I never really believed it was real! </53> <54 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern2Stag" who="Brand"> Slaying such a fiend would be worthy of a skald's song. It will not go down easily, though, so make sure you send enough warriors. </54> <55 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern2Goat" who="Halvard"> 'Tis the most terrifying thing I have seen in my days. And believe me, young lord, I have witnessed a great deal. Many men and women will likely die fighting this beast, if you so command it. </55> <56 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern2Wolf" who="Egil"> By Fenrir, I'm shaking with excitement! How hard can it be to kill? Let's find out! I've got a spot for its head above my fireplace! </56> <57 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern2Raven" who="Liv"> That looks... dangerous. I can see why we would risk our lives fighting it, but is it really worth it? </57> <58 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern2Boar" who="Svarn"> Wyverns are... mighty foes. We usually respect them and leave them be, although killing it would surely impress the she-bear. </58> <59 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern3" who="Rig"> It certainly won't go down without a fight. Warriors, brace yourselves! </59> <60 id="wyv_known_small_wyvern1" who="Rig"> Another wyvern! Hmm, according to legend, the azure ones are somewhat less dangerous than what we encountered earlier. It should be easier to defeat. </60> <61 id="wyv_known_small_wyvern2Stag" who="Brand"> Indeed. We would lose fewer men and women than against the crimson type. </61> <62 id="wyv_known_small_wyvern2Goat" who="Halvard"> It still looks like a formidable opponent. We should not underestimate it. </62> <63 id="wyv_known_small_wyvern2Wolf" who="Egil"> Yeah, but it's less fun, too. The crimson bugger was more... bitey. </63> <64 id="wyv_known_small_wyvern2Raven" who="Liv"> It still looks pretty nasty. But if we REALLY must slay things to show off, it might be a better choice than the crimson, nightmare-fueling one. </64> <65 id="wyv_known_small_wyvern2Boar" who="Svarn"> It is indeed less dangerous than the crimson variety... but make no mistake, it is still a very tough creature. </65> <66 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern1" who="Rig"> By Odin's missing eye! Is this a wyvern? My father boasted of fighting one, but this thing is bigger than a longship! </66> <67 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern2Stag" who="Brand"> It looks fearsome, indeed. We certainly should not expect this battle to be easily won, if winnable at all. </67> <68 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern2Goat" who="Halvard"> Attacking such a beast would be madness, young lord! I beg you not to give in to hubris. My people are tough survivors, but ordering them to face this monster would be tantamount to murder. </68> <69 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern2Wolf" who="Egil"> Whoa, I might actually be experiencing fear for the first time ever. Nah, just kidding. I'm not sure my axes can even put a dent in its scales, though. Only one way to find out! </69> <70 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern2Raven" who="Liv"> Well, this is absurd. Throwing warriors at this creature would be a needless waste of human life. On the other hand–and I can hardly believe I'm considering it–slaying it would give us a definite edge in the contest... </70> <71 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern2Boar" who="Svarn"> I have seen wyverns, but never the crimson kind. I foresee many lives being wiped out if you decide to fight it, although... it would most certainly be the stuff of legends. </71> <72 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern3Stag" who="Rig"> Agreed. At any rate, it would require more than a few warriors to bring it down. I will have to carefully consider this. </72> <73 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern3Goat" who="Rig"> You may just be right, Halvard. Yet somehow I feel we are up to the task... if we prepare carefully beforehand, that is. </73> <74 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern3Wolf" who="Rig"> I know your warriors are ready to die just for a chance to fight such a unique beast. We will probably have to send in quite a few of them, though. </74> <75 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern3Raven" who="Rig"> 'Tis quite a gamble, indeed. We stand to lose many in the fight, but should we succeed... At any rate, we shall have to plan ahead carefully. </75> <76 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern3Boar" who="Rig"> Many lives would be lost, 'tis true. On the other hand, if Borgild's people manage to bring it down, we might be done for. I will have to think it over. </76> <77 id="wyv_known_big_wyvern1" who="Rig"> Another wyvern! Hmm, according to legend, the crimson ones are even deadlier than the azure ones. </77> <78 id="wyv_known_big_wyvern2Stag" who="Brand"> It does look mightier. We should not take this beast lightly. In all likelihood, we shall have to draw even more warriors into the fight. </78> <79 id="wyv_known_big_wyvern2Goat" who="Halvard"> The azure one looked bad enough. I dread to imagine what will happen if we disturb this one's slumber. </79> <80 id="wyv_known_big_wyvern2Wolf" who="Egil"> Yeah, it looks bigger and badder. I wonder if my axes can even make a dent in its scales. Let's find out! </80> <81 id="wyv_known_big_wyvern2Raven" who="Liv"> From a purely rational point of view, it represents even more risk, but for a similar reward. Of course, not killing it would be a missed opportunity entirely. But is it worth the extra danger? </81> <82 id="wyv_known_big_wyvern2Boar" who="Svarn"> The azure wyverns are certainly mighty beasts, but they are nothing compared to the crimson variety. </82> <83 id="giant1" who="Rig"> More Jötnar... </83> <84 id="giant2Stag" who="Brand"> Either befriending them through trade or slaying them and claiming their land would increase our fame. This is essentially an ethical dilemma, so please do as you see fit, my lord. </84> <85 id="giant2Goat" who="Halvard"> If we trade food with them, they become our allies and we gain fame. Of course, we could also slay them and claim their land, but is peace not preferable to war? </85> <86 id="giant2Wolf" who="Egil"> I say we slay 'em and take their land! That oughta show Borgild what we're made of! Sure, we could trade food with them and make them our allies... but that'd be boring. </86> <87 id="giant2Raven" who="Liv"> There are two ways we could gain fame from them: either defeat them and claim their land, or trade food with them until we've befriended them. Both are economically viable options. Decisions, decisions... </87> <88 id="giant2Boar" who="Svarn"> We can either... collaborate with them through trade or... eradicate them and claim their land. Jotnär are powerful allies, but it will be costly. On the other hand, they are mighty foes... </88> <89 id="giant3" who="Rig"> Earning their trust would take a while and cost a lot of food, but we would gain a powerful ally to accomplish other glorious deeds. Slaying them would be swifter but more dangerous and less rewarding. I need to ponder both options. </89> <90 id="end1" who="Rig"> 'Tis over, Borgild. Admit it: I beat you at your own game. </90> <91 id="end2" who="Borgild"> ... </91> <92 id="end3Stag" who="Brand"> Ha! Our victory has rendered her speechless! Do you see how futile your efforts have been, woman? </92> <93 id="end3Goat" who="Halvard"> So, milady, will you finally listen to reason and kneel before Lord Rig? </93> <94 id="end3Wolf" who="Egil"> What's wrong? That little game of yours not so fun anymore? </94> <95 id="end3Raven" who="Liv"> So, will you at last cut your losses and stop this tired nonsense? </95> <96 id="end3Boar" who="Svarn"> You have been... bested, she-bear. Do you now... see what I see in Lord Rig? </96> <97 id="end4" who="Borgild"> All right. I can't weasel out of this. Ye brought me down a peg or two, hornless king. </97> <98 id="end5" who="Rig"> That is the spirit! Do you then recognize me as your rightful king and swear allegiance to me? </98> <99 id="end6" who="Borgild"> As per the rules o' the contest, I'll submit to ya. But make no mistake: until you show me the Regal Horn, I'll NEVER accept you as my king! </99> <100 id="end7" who="Rig"> Fine by me. I am sure I will have use for your skills in the days ahead. Let us not tarry. </100> <101 id="endBelligerent1" who="Rig"> Borgild, all things considered, I have decided to put an end to this. Submit now. That is not a request. </101> <102 id="endBelligerent2" who="Borgild"> Wait, that's not how it's meant to be! Ye must respect the rules of the contest! </102> <103 id="endBelligerent3Stag" who="Brand"> It seems Lord Rig has grown impatient, though I'll concede that winning this way is not very honorable. </103> <104 id="endBelligerent3Goat" who="Halvard"> Apologies, milady, but there are more important matters at hand. Let us avoid shedding any more blood: please yield peacefully. </104> <105 id="endBelligerent3Wolf" who="Egil"> You fought well–we're just better than you. Way better, ha ha! </105> <106 id="endBelligerent3Raven" who="Liv"> Only the outcome matters. Now, surrender without making a fuss–do not give the men that satisfaction. I promise you will not regret joining us. Just swallow your pride for now. </106> <107 id="endBelligerent3Boar" who="Svarn"> I... understand your anger, but please heed our words. There is... so much more at stake than just honor. </107> <108 id="endBelligerent4" who="Borgild"> That's unfair! Rig, you despicable dog, do ye have no sense of honor? Aren't you supposed to be high king? </108> <109 id="endBelligerent5" who="Rig"> Ha ha! King? What king? I see no Regal Horn. No Regal Horn, no high king. Remember? </109> <110 id="endBelligerent6" who="Borgild"> What is your agenda? What're you after? Some kind o'... sense of achievement? </110> <111 id="endBelligerent7" who="Rig"> Maybe so. Anyway, do you agree to swear allegiance to me now? </111> <112 id="endBelligerent8" who="Borgild"> Grr... I'll never accept you as my king, but you've made your point. I concede! </112> <113 id="defeat1" who="Borgild"> Well, well, well... Looks like the mighty "high king" ain't so mighty after all. So, about this "satisfying the victor's every whim" deal... </113> <114 id="defeat2Stag" who="Brand"> My lord, I am ashamed to have failed you. She has won, and so we must surrender honorably. </114> <115 id="defeat2Goat" who="Halvard"> What did I tell you, young lord? How could you put this venture in jeopardy just for show? All is lost now... </115> <116 id="defeat2Wolf" who="Egil"> What do ya know! Looks like we have a new queen. Hey, Borg, if you need a king by your side, I'm all yours! Ow-hoooo! </116> <117 id="defeat2Raven" who="Liv"> Ah, well, it seems I have yet a new master. But I shall be glad to serve under a woman this time! Hail to the high queen! </117> <118 id="defeat2Boar" who="Svarn"> This... this cannot be happening! None will be able to stop Hvedrung now! Lord Rig, you have FAILED your people and the gods! </118> <119 id="defeat3" who="Rig"> I... I cannot believe it... </119> <120 id="defeat4" who="Rig"> Lady Borgild, I concede and pledge my allegiance to you... </120> <121 id="bearFame1Win1" who="Borgild"> You're falling behind, hornless king! You did understand the rules of the contest, right? </121> <122 id="bearFame1Win2" who="Rig"> I am just giving you a headstart, usurper! </122> <123 id="bearFame1Lose1" who="Rig"> Hey, Borgild, it looks as though you're falling behind. </123> <124 id="bearFame1Lose2" who="Borgild"> Yeah, keep talking... I'm just giving you a headstart! </124> <125 id="bearFame2Win1" who="Borgild"> Hey, mighty "high king", you're obviously no good at this, so let me give you a tip: do what I'm doing–that's how I got ahead of you. </125> <126 id="bearFame2Win2Stag" who="Brand"> Sheesh! Will this woman ever shut up? </126> <127 id="bearFame2Win2Goat" who="Halvard"> Slow and steady wins the race, milady. </127> <128 id="bearFame2Win2Wolf" who="Egil"> This chick's as cocky as she is ruthless. I think I'm in love. </128> <129 id="bearFame2Win2RavenA" who="Liv"> Trash talking is vulgar and pointless. </129> <130 id="bearFame2Win2RavenB" who="Liv"> Scumbag. </130> <131 id="bearFame2Win2Boar" who="Svarn"> Fame... is like a flower. Yours is... blooming today, but it shall be wilting tomorrow... </131> <132 id="bearFame2Win3" who="Rig"> Let us not be distracted by her taunts. Though I must admit she is irksome. </132> <133 id="bearFame2Lose1" who="Rig"> Usurper, you're evidently not so skilled at this, so here is a friendly tip: just do what I am doing–that is how I got ahead of you. </133> <134 id="bearFame2Lose2Stag" who="Brand"> Well said, my lord! </134> <135 id="bearFame2Lose2Goat" who="Halvard"> I suppose a bit of taunting cannot hurt. </135> <136 id="bearFame2Lose2Wolf" who="Egil"> Booyah! Hear that, Borg? Or are you too far behind? </136> <137 id="bearFame2Lose2Raven" who="Liv"> Tee hee. </137> <138 id="bearFame2Lose2Boar" who="Svarn"> Oh... that was actually... quite humorous. Ho ho ho. </138> <139 id="bearFame2Lose3" who="Borgild"> Och, how old are ya? </139> <140 id="bearFame3Win1" who="Borgild"> Well, it looks like I'm going to win. If you're all right with it, I'll take some time to make a list of errands for you once you're my slave. </140> <141 id="bearFame3Win2" who="Rig"> Do not get ahead of yourself, usurper! 'Tis not over till it's over! </141> <142 id="bearFame3Lose1" who="Rig"> So, usurper, do you recognize me as your high king? </142> <143 id="bearFame3Lose2" who="Borgild"> Why should I? Last I checked, you hadn't proven your worth. </143> <144 id="bearFame3Lose3" who="Rig"> I was merely warming up. Obviously I will win at this rate. </144> <145 id="bearFame3Lose4" who="Borgild"> Grr... </145> <146 id="endDrawingNear" who="Rig"> Looks like the contest is coming to a close... </146> <147 id="borgCalmsKaija1" who="Borgild"> It's fine, Kaija... </147> <148 id="borgCalmsKaija2" who="Borgild"> That's a good girl! </148>
Trials.tutorial: <0 id="title"> The Contest </0> <1 id="sentence1"> To prove your worth to Borgild and make her recognize you as high king, you must raise your [Fame]. Do so faster than she does. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> Many feats will bring you fame: claiming camps, slaying colossal creatures, and of course developing your clan. </2>

Guardian.name: Tremors
Guardian.desc: The Runestone of Asgard is at last within reach, in a desolate, rime-covered steppe. We need only walk there!
Guardian.objectives: <0 id="mRunestone"> Reach the Runestone of Asgard and decipher its runes. </0> <1 id="mForge"> Build the [Forge]. </1> <2 id="mRimeSteel"> Mine [RimeSteel]. </2> <3 id="mWurmslayer"> Forge the Wurmslayer. </3> <4 id="mKillHrimgandr"> Bring the Hrímgandr down using the Wurmslayer. </4> <5 id="bTime"> Slay the Hrímgandr before Year ::value::. </5> <6 id="bUnits"> Have ::value:: different types of military units at any one time. </6> <7 id="bMine"> Exploit ::value:: Rimesteel mines at any one time. </7>
Guardian.cinematic: <0> I had just managed to subdue Borgild and her Bear Clan on our way to the Runestone. They were, like us, from the old continent, but had come ashore in a completely different place. </0> <1> As we neared the Runestone, Svarn grew more and more agitated. He confessed to be dreading "something" that lay ahead, though he couldn't tell what it was. </1> <2> Some of our people were also reluctant to move forward; Northgard was getting harsher and harsher, as if trying to deter us from pursuing our goal... </2>
Guardian.texts: <0 id="start1" who="Rig"> Hmm, the air is g-getting colder. Much c-colder, as a matter of f-fact. </0> <1 id="start2" who="Brand"> That is one w-way to put it... I am f-f-freezing! </1> <2 id="start3" who="Egil"> Yeah, I'm kind of regretting all my l-life choices, being a b-b-berserker and all. I c-can't feel my t-toes... </2> <3 id="start4" who="Halvard"> I j-just long for a hot s-soup b-by the hearth... </3> <4 id="start5" who="Liv"> I am thinking of all the f-firewood we'll have to b-burn to get warm again, and it is making me d-depressed... </4> <5 id="start6" who="Borgild"> Come, now! A little cold air never killed no one! Are ye all babies? Want me to tuck ye in warm little beddies? </5> <6 id="start7" who="Egil"> Hey, I'm all f-for you warming up my b-bed... </6> <7 id="start8" who="Liv"> Really, Egil... </7> <8 id="start9" who="Borgild"> Let's just say ye're not me type, doggy boy... </8> <9 id="start10" who="Rig"> Lo! We have arrived... the R-Runestone of A-Asgard lies yonder! Let us hie there! </9> <10 id="start11" who="Rig"> S-Svarn? </10> <11 id="start12" who="Svarn"> We should... turn back. I... do not wish... to FACE what lies ahead! </11> <12 id="start13" who="Borgild"> Come on, piggy, it's just a big stone. Ye boars aren't afraid of rocks now, are ye? </12> <13 id="start14" who="Rig"> Whoa! What was that? </13> <14 id="start15" who="Svarn"> NO! NOT... THIS! THIS BEAST HAS... HAUNTED MY DREAMS ALL MY LIFE! </14> <15 id="start16" who="Borgild"> Ooooh! 'Tis a Hrímgandr! I never saw one with me own two eyes. All me ancestors famously killed one each! </15> <16 id="start17" who="Rig"> You th-think you c-can s-slay that b-beast, B-Borgild? </16> <17 id="start18" who="Borgild"> Well, I can't pass up the chance to hang its head in my trophy room. Even if I die tryin'. Let's settle here. </17> <18 id="start19" who="Rig"> Ahh, 'tis good to feel my fingers again. So, how should we go about slaying the beast? </18> <19 id="start20" who="Borgild"> Those beasties are pretty much invulnerable to basic weapons. We have to forge a special family weapon we call the Wurmslayer. We'll need some rimesteel and a forge. </19> <20 id="start21" who="Rig"> RIMESTEEL? The famous icy ore said to be found only in Niflheim?! </20> <21 id="start22" who="Borgild"> Ye southerners sure know how to inflate yer legends. No need to go to Niflheim: Hrímgandar typically live in rimesteel-rich environments, so we shouldn't have too much trouble finding some 'round here. </21> <22 id="start23" who="Rig"> Weeeelll... good luck with that. </22> <23 id="start24" who="Brand"> Borgild, I will help you fend off the beast while the miners are at work. Even if we cannot make a dent in its armor for the time being, we should be able to distract it, no? </23> <24 id="start25" who="Halvard"> Clearly I cannot watch this from the sidelines... I shall help too, Lady Borgild! </24> <25 id="start26" who="Egil"> Can't let a broad take all the credit for downing such a big monster now, can I? Count me in, Borg! </25> <26 id="start27" who="Liv"> Not too keen on being devoured alive, but... we haven't much of a choice, it would appear. Count me in, too! </26> <27 id="start28" who="Svarn"> I need to face my DEEPEST fears... I shall fight with you all! </27> <28 id="start29" who="Borgild"> All right, let's do this! </28> <29 id="enoughIronNoForge1" who="Rig"> We have enough rimesteel to start forging the Wurmslayer! </29> <30 id="enoughIronNoForge2" who="Borgild"> So... what are ye waitin' for? Build a forge already! </30> <31 id="wurmSlayerPart1" who="Rig"> The Wurmslayer's blade has been forged! </31> <32 id="wurmSlayerPart2" who="Rig"> The Wurmslayer's crossguard has been forged! </32> <33 id="wurmSlayerPart3" who="Rig"> The Wurmslayer is complete! </33> <34 id="killHrimgandr1" who="Borgild"> Och! 'Twas about time! Now I get to live up to my family's tradition of slaying Hrímgandar! </34> <35 id="killHrimgandr2" who="Egil"> Oh, boy, I can't wait! </35> <36 id="killHrimgandr3" who="Brand"> This ought to make us famous, for sure. </36> <37 id="killHrimgandr4" who="Halvard"> I cannot lie, I am indeed a tad excited. But mostly terrified. </37> <38 id="killHrimgandr5" who="Liv"> Exciting, indeed. I cannot wait to be chewed alive. </38> <39 id="killHrimgandr6" who="Svarn"> YAAAAAAAAH! </39> <40 id="winterStage1" who="Borgild"> Ooh, is it me or is this winter cooler than the last one? </40> <41 id="winterStage2" who="Borgild"> Hmm, winters are getting colder and colder... I don't mind, but maybe we should hurry just a little. Hrímgandar love cold winters even more than I do. </41> <42 id="winterStage3" who="Borgild"> Okay, it's getting seriously cold now, even for me. If it keeps getting worse, the Hrímgandr will become invincible for good. </42> <43 id="winterStage4" who="Borgild"> Th-this is b-bad... Even I am f-freezing... At th-this r-rate, n-next w-winter will b-be our last... </43> <44 id="defeatWinter1" who="Borgild"> 'T-tis m-mighty c-cold... Th-there's no w-way w-we can k-kill the b-beastie now... </44> <45 id="defeatWinter2" who="Rig"> D-darn, we have to b-back down... </45> <46 id="defeatWinter3" who="Svarn"> Th-then it m-means th-that nothing will stand in Hvedrung's w-way now... All is l-lost... </46> <47 id="end1" who="Svarn"> I feel... relieved... </47> <48 id="end2" who="Borgild"> See, piggy? The beastie's dead. I think I'll need a bigger fireplace, though. 'Tis a big one. </48> <49 id="end3" who="Halvard"> Strange... The air suddenly became slightly warmer... </49> <50 id="end4" who="Borgild"> Me ancestors used to say killing a Hrímgandr could hasten spring. Maybe that's why winters were getting harsher in the region? </50> <51 id="end5" who="Rig"> Svarn, the only thing left to do is decipher the Runestone of Asgard... </51> <52 id="end6" who="Svarn"> Yes... Let us... see what TRUTH the runes have to tell us... </52> <53 id="firstBannerDefeatedStag" who="Brand"> Companions, I must withdraw for now. I shall return once I am back on my feet. Stay brave! </53> <54 id="firstBannerDefeatedGoat" who="Halvard"> I am not as hale as I once was... I must catch my breath and get these wounds taken care of... But I will return once I have recovered! </54> <55 id="firstBannerDefeatedWolf" who="Egil"> Darn, that thing packs quite a punch... Hate to say it, but I need to back down for now. I'll come back soon as I get these wounds patched up! </55> <56 id="firstBannerDefeatedRaven" who="Liv"> Ouch! Sorry, all, I have to back down for now... I will come back once my wounds have healed. Stay strong! </56> <57 id="firstBannerDefeatedBoar" who="Svarn"> I am... heavily wounded. Sorry, companions, but I must... withdraw for now. I shall return as soon as I have... healed. </57> <58 id="hrimgandrFeedsOffRimesteel1" who="Rig"> What the...?! The Hrímgandr just devoured a rimesteel deposit! </58> <59 id="hrimgandrFeedsOffRimesteel2" who="Borgild"> Aye, Hrímgandar feed on rimesteel. That's why they live close to deposits. </59> <60 id="hrimgandrFeedsOffRimesteel3" who="Rig"> I suppose we shouldn't let it get too comfortable, then. It has probably been idle for too long. If we let it eat all the rimesteel, we'll be left with no way to slay it. </60> <61 id="defeatNoRimesteel1" who="Borgild"> My prospectors just reported there wasn't enough rimesteel left in those plains to forge a Wurmslayer... It's hopeless. </61> <62 id="defeatNoRimesteel2" who="Rig"> Hmm, there has to be a way... Could we wait for it to die of old age? </62> <63 id="defeatNoRimesteel3" who="Borgild"> Hah... Do ye have a thousand years to spare? It's hopeless, I tell ya! </63> <64 id="firstRimesteelColonized" who="Borgild"> Good, 'tis the first territory with rimesteel we control... We'd best defend it, 'cause the beastie don't like trespassers! </64>
Guardian.tutorial: <0 id="title"> The Clan of Bjarki </0> <1 id="sentence1"> This clan is less susceptible to the effects of winter and cold than others, and is even more powerful and productive during that season! </1> <2 id="sentence2"> Their mastery of shields and ability to train armored bears make them experts in the art of defense. </2>

Act2Ending.name: The Runestone of Asgard
Act2Ending.cinematic: <0> We had finally reached the Runestone of Asgard. Whoever Hvedrung was, his actions seemed to be foretold by the old scriptures etched in the stone. </0> <1> Svarn translated: "He will want to set the men free from the yoke of the All-Father, for he does not want them to share in his feast, and to this end he will destroy Bifrost." </1> <2> "As the wail of Gjallarhorn echoes through the skies, the sons of Muspell will march on Asgard. Thus the gods shall meet their fate, and the age of men shall begin," Svarn concluded thoughtfully. </2> <3> There was no map to Bifrost on the Runestone, but one stanza read that it was "beyond Bergelmir's Throat." This was a kenning (a metaphor) for the icy cliffs far to the north. </3>

Frozen.name: Fimbulvinter
Frozen.desc: We have reached Bergelmir's Throat, the narrow pass opening on Bifröst. Winter seems to know no end here.
Frozen.objectives: <0 id="mWinter"> Wait for Fimbulvinter to end (::value:: years). </0> <1 id="mArmy"> Survive the frozen army of the dead. </1> <2 id="bTower"> Build at least ::value:: upgraded [WatchTower]s. </2> <3 id="bNoTower"> Survive without building a [WatchTower]. </3> <4 id="bAlly"> Do not allow any of your allies to fall. </4>
Frozen.cinematic: <0> As we neared Bergelmir's Throat, we were greeted by an eternal winter; Borgild called it Fimbulvinter, and that alone was one of our mightiest foes yet. </0> <1> But as the Norns would have it, something much deadlier than cold and starvation was lurking in the freezing mist... </1>
Frozen.texts: <0 id="start1" who="Rig"> You said it was getting warmer, Halvard? </0> <1 id="start2" who="Halvard"> I stand corrected. </1> <2 id="start3" who="Brand"> Good thing we have better clothes now! </2> <3 id="start4" who="Egil"> S-speak f-for yours-self, g-golden b-boy... </3> <4 id="start5" who="Borgild"> This be Fimbulvinter. </4> <5 id="start6" who="Liv"> Fimbul-what now? </5> <6 id="start7" who="Borgild"> The eternal winter, luv. </6> <7 id="start7original2" who="Borgild"> On the bright side, those undead freaks will stay frozen forever. </7> <8 id="start7original3" who="Borgild"> The downside is, we'll never get past this here wall of ice. </8> <9 id="start7alt" who="Borgild"> Which means we are never going to get past this here wall of ice... </9> <10 id="start8" who="Rig"> So, what now...? Is this the end of the road? </10> <11 id="start9" who="Svarn"> No... "Eternal" is a... poetic license, not to be taken literally. Fimbulvinter is an extremely HARSH and long winter that is supposed to last several years. </11> <12 id="start10" who="Svarn"> The legends say it is a... harbinger of Ragnarök. If they are to be believed, Hvedrung might be... close to achieving his goal. </12> <13 id="start11" who="Rig"> Then we "only" have to wait for the return of spring? </13> <14 id="start12" who="Halvard"> What concerns me slightly is what will happen when the wretched creatures thaw out... </14> <15 id="start12alt1" who="Halvard"> Then we may not look forward to spring, after all... Lo! </15> <16 id="start12alt2" who="Halvard"> The blizzard has lifted... What are those wretched figures? </16> <17 id="start13" who="Brand"> Hmm, good point. </17> <18 id="start13alt" who="Brand"> A frightful sight, indeed... Luckily, they are frozen solid. But you are right, Halvard: if the wall is bound to thaw, so are they! </18> <19 id="start14" who="Halvard"> What a peculiar feeling. We usually dread the coming of winter, not its end! </19> <20 id="start15" who="Rig"> Bergelmir's Throat is a funnel-shaped gorge, and we are on its broad end. I suggest we spread out our settlements to weaken the impact of the attack. </20> <21 id="start16" who="Liv"> A reasonable solution. That way, no one will bear the full brunt of the assault. </21> <22 id="playerCenterAllyIntroStag" who="Rig"> Brand and I will be defending the middle. </22> <23 id="playerCenterAllyIntroGoat" who="Rig"> Halvard and I will be defending the middle. </23> <24 id="playerCenterAllyIntroWolf" who="Rig"> Egil and I will be defending the middle. </24> <25 id="playerCenterAllyIntroRaven" who="Rig"> Liv and I will be defending the middle. </25> <26 id="playerCenterAllyIntroBoar" who="Rig"> Svarn and I will be defending the middle. </26> <27 id="playerCenterAllyIntroBear" who="Rig"> Borgild and I will be defending the middle. </27> <28 id="playerRightAllyIntroStag" who="Rig"> Brand will protect our right flank... </28> <29 id="playerRightAllyIntroGoat" who="Rig"> Halvard will protect our right flank... </29> <30 id="playerRightAllyIntroWolf" who="Rig"> Egil will protect our right flank... </30> <31 id="playerRightAllyIntroRaven" who="Rig"> Liv will protect our right flank... </31> <32 id="playerRightAllyIntroBoar" who="Rig"> Svarn will protect our right flank... </32> <33 id="playerRightAllyIntroBear" who="Rig"> Borgild will protect our right flank... </33> <34 id="playerLeftAllyIntroStag" who="Rig"> ... and Brand the left one. </34> <35 id="playerLeftAllyIntroGoat" who="Rig"> ... and Halvard the left one. </35> <36 id="playerLeftAllyIntroWolf" who="Rig"> ... and Egil the left one. </36> <37 id="playerLeftAllyIntroRaven" who="Rig"> ... and Liv the left one. </37> <38 id="playerLeftAllyIntroBoar" who="Rig"> ... and Svarn the left one. </38> <39 id="playerLeftAllyIntroBear" who="Rig"> ... and Borgild the left one. </39> <40 id="allyAgreesStag" who="Brand"> Very well, my lord. </40> <41 id="allyAgreesGoat" who="Halvard"> As you command. </41> <42 id="allyAgreesWolf" who="Egil"> G-got it! </42> <43 id="allyAgreesRaven" who="Liv"> Understood. </43> <44 id="allyAgreesBoar" who="Svarn"> So be it. </44> <45 id="allyAgreesBear" who="Borgild"> Aye! </45> <46 id="start17" who="Rig"> Then it is settled. Let us gather as many resources as we can and prepare to resist the charge when Fimbulvinter ends. </46> <47 id="winterHurryEndOfYear1" who="Rig"> The first year has flown by. We have three more years before the end of Fimbulvinter. The air is already warming. </47> <48 id="winterHurryEndOfYear2" who="Rig"> Only two years left before the thaw. Now is no time to rest! </48> <49 id="winterHurryLastYear" who="Rig"> Another year has passed... Fimbulvinter should end next year, if the legends are true. We ought to work twice as hard! </49> <50 id="winterEnds" who="Rig"> Fimbulvinter is over! </50> <51 id="armyAttack1Stag" who="Brand"> My lord, the remainder of the army is thawing out! </51> <52 id="armyAttack1Goat" who="Halvard"> By Odin's eye... The frozen army is bound to descend on us! </52> <53 id="armyAttack1Wolf" who="Egil"> Ah... It's warmin' up finally... Freaks incoming! Get ready to fight! </53> <54 id="armyAttack1Raven" who="Liv"> The army of the dead is thawing out... </54> <55 id="armyAttack1Boar" who="Svarn"> The dead are... inbound... </55> <56 id="armyAttack1Bear" who="Borgild"> 'Tis warmer, all right! The freaks be incoming! </56> <57 id="armyAttack2" who="Rig"> Brace yourselves for battle! This is the final assault... We will hold our ground... or die trying! </57> <58 id="rightAllyFallsStag" who="Brand"> My lord, the eastern front has fallen! We must prepare for an attack on our right flank! </58> <59 id="rightAllyFallsGoat" who="Halvard"> Young lord, I fear our friends on the eastern front have fallen! We should brace for an attack from the right! </59> <60 id="rightAllyFallsWolf" who="Egil"> Those guys on the right side didn't make it. Just means more monsters for me to fight! Sweet! </60> <61 id="rightAllyFallsRaven" who="Liv"> Blast, the eastern front has failed to hold their position. Our right side is now exposed. </61> <62 id="rightAllyFallsBoar" who="Svarn"> Our friends on the... eastern front have fallen. We MUST be prepared to deal with their attackers. </62> <63 id="rightAllyFallsBear" who="Borgild"> Och, those weaklings on the eastern side didn't make it! Prepare to be attacked from the right! </63> <64 id="leftAllyFallsStag" who="Brand"> My lord, the western front has fallen! Our left flank is bound to be harried soon! </64> <65 id="leftAllyFallsGoat" who="Halvard"> Young lord, our friends on the western front did all they could, but they have been overwhelmed. We are bound to be attacked from the left! </65> <66 id="leftAllyFallsWolf" who="Egil"> And there goes the left side! I get their share of the freaks to battle! Nice! </66> <67 id="leftAllyFallsRaven" who="Liv"> Bad news... The western front is no more. Our left side is now vulnerable. </67> <68 id="leftAllyFallsBoar" who="Svarn"> Our allies on the... western front are no more. We must BRACE for an attack from the left. </68> <69 id="leftAllyFallsBear" who="Borgild"> Ye got to be kidding me. The men to the west had ONE job! If they've failed, we'll be attacked from the left soon. </69> <70 id="end1" who="Rig"> Phew, that was not an easy battle. Salvage whatever is left and heal the wounded. </70> <71 id="end2" who="Brand"> Lo! The wall of ice is melting! </71> <72 id="end3" who="Egil"> It's about time! Let's get out of here before I cool down. </72> <73 id="end4" who="Liv"> At last! I just hope what lies beyond is not even colder. </73> <74 id="end5" who="Borgild"> Even I am fed up with all that snow. Think I've got rime in me boots. </74> <75 id="end6" who="Halvard"> I fear the worst is yet to come. </75> <76 id="end7" who="Svarn"> Indeed... Beyond Bergelmir's Throat is Bifröst... and Hvedrung. We must STOP this madman. </76> <77 id="end8" who="Rig"> We must carry on. Whatever is next will be the end of our quest. We are nearing the northern borders of Northgard. </77> <78 id="end10" who="Rig"> Let us march on! TO BIFROST! </78> <79 id="end9" who="Rig"> I can only promise you more blood and tears. But our fate, and that of Northgard–perhaps all of humanity–will soon be sealed. </79>
Frozen.tutorial: <0 id="title"> Fimbulvinter </0> <1 id="sentence1"> The Great Winter will last several years. Wait for spring to melt the great ice wall. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> Brace yourself for when the army of the dead will thaw out. Protect your allies, for you are stronger together! </2>

Bifrost.name: Bifröst
Bifrost.desc: Bifröst, the legendary bridge leading to Asgard, sits in this region. Hvedrung is already there, and we are on the brink of Ragnarök. We must stop him at all costs!
Bifrost.objectives: <0 id="mBifrost"> Protect [Bifrost] at all costs. </0> <1 id="mHvedrung"> Slay Hvedrung. </1> <2 id="bPortal"> Seal one [Muspell] each year. </2> <3 id="bKobold"> Annihilate all the poor [Kobold]s. </3> <4 id="bBifrost"> Do not let [Bifrost] fall below 50% durability. </4>
Bifrost.cinematic: <0> At last we were reaching our goal. The land where Bifrost had been concealed for eons was... peaceful. Heavenly, even. </0> <1> But as we marched forward, a great indescribable sound shook earth and sky alike. It still echoes through my mind. </1> <2> This was, of course, Gjallarhorn's wail, and the beginning of Ragnarök. </2> <3> Hvedrung was ahead of us, ready to set the sons of Muspell loose on Northgard. </3> <4> Everything we had done to get here, every life sacrificed, would have been in vain if we failed to stop the tyrant from destroying the legendary bridge. </4>
Bifrost.texts: <0 id="start0" who="Rig"> Bifröst, at last! </0> <1 id="start1" who="Rig"> What a dreadful sound! </1> <2 id="start2" who="Svarn"> Hvedrung has blown Gjallarhorn... Thus, we are on the brink of Ragnarök. The sons of Muspell shall be here soon. </2> <3 id="start3" who="Rig"> Hvedrung, stop this folly at once! </3> <4 id="start4" who="Hvedrung"> I salute your determination, young king. But you are too late: with Gjallarhorn, I will open the gates of Muspelheim. </4> <5 id="start5" who="Hvedrung"> This world shall soon be engulfed in flames... but believe me, 'tis no folly. </5> <6 id="start6" who="Rig"> But why...? What have you to gain from all this? And how did the Runestone of Asgard foretell your baleful deeds? Who ARE you? </6> <7 id="start7" who="Hvedrung"> Who I am is unimportant, as were your father and your pathetic quest for revenge. All that matters is what will be gained from destroying Bifröst. </7> <8 id="start8" who="Rig"> You are a madman! What do you want? To slay the gods? To become the absolute ruler of Asgard? </8> <9 id="start9" who="Hvedrung"> I do not seek to rule over gods or men. I wish to set Midgard and Asgard asunder, to set men free from Odin's will. </9> <10 id="start10" who="Rig"> That is nonsense! What would humans have to gain from losing the All-Father? What good would a world of ashes be to us? </10> <11 id="start11" who="Hvedrung"> Odin lives in perpetual dread of Ragnarök, for he knows he shall meet his fate. He has been training our brethren in Valhöll in hopes of preventing his inevitable demise. </11> <12 id="start12" who="Hvedrung"> He has no love for humans. To him they are mere puppets, whom he has been stringing along with empty promises of eternal glory since the dawn of time. </12> <13 id="start13" who="Svarn"> Do not listen to him, my lord... Hvedrung is a heretic. His words have poisoned many of my brothers' souls... </13> <14 id="start14" who="Svarn"> There is no... reasoning with him. The very existence of my... rebellion proves he will only respond to... force. </14> <15 id="start15" who="Hvedrung"> You are wiser than I am, Svarn. You always have been. But your faith is misguided. Fight the inevitable if you so desire. </15> <16 id="start16" who="Hvedrung"> Now, let Ragnarök... COMMENCE! </16> <17 id="start17" who="DefaultBannerman"> Fire giants incoming! </17> <18 id="start18Goat" who="Halvard"> Young lord, the final battle is nigh! You can count on us and the settlements we built all over Northgard to send you support! </18> <19 id="start18Stag" who="Brand"> My lord, the final battle is nigh! You can count on us and the settlements we built all over Northgard to send you support! </19> <20 id="muspellGate1" who="Rig"> Bifröst is under attack too! We must send troops to defend it! </20> <21 id="muspellGate2" who="DefaultBannerman"> Huh? The fire giants died suddenly! What is happening? </21> <22 id="muspellGate3" who="Rig"> It seems the Eldthursar are unable to sustain their presence far from the flames of Muspelheim. This will work in our favor, but we cannot leave Bifröst unattended. </22> <23 id="muspellGate4" who="Rig"> We must hie to any gate we can find, and then seal them! </23> <24 id="vedrfolnir1" who="DefaultBannerman"> Is that... Vedrfolnir? </24> <25 id="vedrfolnir2" who="Rig"> Its senses must have been disrupted by Gjallarhorn. The poor thing has crashed to the ground. </25> <26 id="start22old" who="Rig"> I know I am asking much of you all. Everything we have done–every life taken, every life lost–has led us to this point. </26> <27 id="start23old" who="Rig"> We must protect Bifröst at all costs! We cannot allow Ragnarök to happen! Hvedrung dies this day! </27> <28 id="helpReceivedStag" who="Brand"> My lord, we have just received a shipment of supplies and reinforcements from our Northgard allies. </28> <29 id="helpReceivedGoat" who="Halvard"> Young lord, we have received help and supplies from our Northgardian fellows! </29> <30 id="helpReceivedWolf" who="Egil"> Hey, Rig, we just got more guys and supplies from all over Northgard! </30> <31 id="helpReceivedRaven" who="Liv"> I've been informed that our settlements all across Northgard have sent help and supplies. </31> <32 id="helpReceivedBoar" who="Svarn"> Our Northgardian... brethren have sent us men and a shipment of supplies! </32> <33 id="helpReceivedBear" who="Borgild"> Hey, hornless king, we just received blokes and a bunch of supplies from the rest of Northgard! </33> <34 id="end1" who="Rig"> At long last! I have finally cornered you. </34> <35 id="end2" who="Hvedrung"> ... </35> <36 id="end3" who="Svarn"> Hvedrung, you have... lost. Ragnarök has not... come to pass. Everything you did was in vain. </36> <37 id="end4" who="Egil"> He's yours! Kill this bastard! </37> <38 id="end5" who="Borgild"> Look, the coward surrenders! Kill him anyway! </38> <39 id="end6" who="Brand"> What do you have to say for yourself, fiend? </39> <40 id="end7" who="Hvedrung"> ... </40> <41 id="end8" who="Halvard"> So much suffering... and for what? </41> <42 id="end9" who="Liv"> Well, clearly he has nothing to say in his own defense. </42> <43 id="end10" who="Brand"> Your revenge is at hand, my lord. </43> <44 id="end11" who="Rig"> You must be truly mad. Faced with your own demise, you dare laugh at my face? I will put you out of your misery. </44> <45 id="end12" who="Hvedrung"> You are victorious, high king... </45> <46 id="end13" who="Hvedrung"> ... But you still arrived too late. </46> <47 id="defeat1" who="Hvedrung"> Finally... the sons of Muspell have destroyed Bifröst... </47> <48 id="defeat2" who="Hvedrung"> Odin, prepare to meet your fate! </48> <49 id="Horn1" who="Hvedrung"> [Vuvuzela] </49> <50 id="allGatesSealed1" who="Rig"> There, all the gates have been sealed. We can call back the other bannermen, as we no longer need them as backup. </50> <51 id="allGatesSealed2" who="DefaultBannerman"> Understood. </51>
Bifrost.tutorial: <0 id="title"> The Sons of Muspell </0> <1 id="sentence1"> Fire giants will pour from the gates of Muspell. Fend them off while trying to seal as many gates as possible to reduce their inflow. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> Protect Bifröst at all costs, survive the assault by Hvedrung's lieutenants, and put an end to his folly when the time comes! </2>

GameEnding.name: Ragnarök
GameEnding.cinematic: <0> Hvedrung was finally in my grasp. He had failed and we were the victors. Or so I thought. </0> <1> Just as I was about to end his miserable life, Hvedrung smiled peacefully, betraying no hint of regret or bitterness. </1> <2> "You are victorious, High King," he said, "but you still arrived too late. Bifrost may still stand, yet the World Tree has been shaken to its roots. You think you prevented Ragnarök; I say we are in the midst of it." </2> <3> He went on: "My work here is done; the men may not yet be free from Odin's yoke, but they now know that defiance is an option. This is the dawn of a new era. Do what you will with me, spare me or kill me; it matters not." </3> <4> Why those words pierced my soul, I shall never know. I suddenly lost all will to kill him, realizing how futile it would be. It would never bring my father back, and he was right; Ragnarök WAS happening. </4> <5> Or rather... it IS happening. This is a new era indeed. Our story is not over; it is only beginning. Northgard needs to heal, and we will be here to tend to its wounds. </5> <6> So, this continent we once called untamed and hostile... We shall now call it… </6> <7> Home. </7>

Maelstrom.name: Dying World (Maelstrom)
Maelstrom.objectives: <0 id="m0"> Colonize the Portal to Yggdrazil and keep controle during one year </0> <1 id="b0"> Kill at least 20 Valkyries </1> <2 id="b1"> Reach 10 happiness and keep that during one year </2> <3 id="b2"> Reach Portal before year 4 </3>
Maelstrom.cinematic: <0> At last we were reaching our goal. But as we marched forward, a great indescribable sound shook earth and sky alike. It still echoes through my mind. </0> <1> This was, of course, Gjallarhorn's wail, and the beginning of Ragnarök. It had opened the portal to Bifrost, and in so doing had upset the world itself. </1> <2> Hurrying across a Northgard that was more wretched than ever, we made our way to the portal to thwart Hvedrung's baleful plans. </2>

Debug.name: Debug
Debug.objectives: <0 id="m0"> Test objectif 1 </0> <1 id="m1"> Test objectif 2 : ::value:: </1>

BannerStag.desc: Proud and noble at heart, the bannerman of the Stag Clan is a loyal man who lives and fights with honor. Nothing matters more to him than his people's wellbeing. He is faithful to you, as his father was to yours, and is willing to help you exact your revenge... and conquer Northgard!

BannerGoat.desc: The elderly bannerman of the Goat Clan is a wise and kind-hearted man focused on the survival of his people. He abhors senseless violence, but still packs quite a punch when provoked. He and the Heidrun Clan pledged allegiance to you after you saved them from ravenous wolves.

BannerWolf.desc: A ruthless and impetuous young berserker, the bannerman of the Wolf Clan is mostly in it for the mayhem. Brand had little trouble rallying him to your cause: a quest for vengeance and the prospect of glorious battle were enough to get him excited.

BannerRaven.desc: Ambitious and pragmatic, the cunning bannermaiden of the Raven Clan likes to control every parameter of a situation and hates wasting time or Kröwns on futile pursuits. Seeing that the tide was turning, she didn't hesitate to kill Hagen, her mentor, to prove her loyalty to you.

BannerBoar.desc: The taciturn spiritual leader of the Boar Clan rebels is a sage and warrior who lives a simple life, close to nature and in accordance with the Old Ways. His uprising against Hvedrung was close to being crushed when you intervened. He is more than willing to help you, since you have a common nemesis.

BannerBear.desc: Brave and arrogant, the bannermaiden of the Bear Clan is a tough woman who bows to no one and shows little mercy for the weakhearted. She refused to recognize you as the rightful king since you lost the Regal Horn, and so she challenged you to a contest, from which you emerged victorious. She had no choice but to grudgingly pledge her allegiance.
